Title: Performance Analyst
Description:
About Wolt

At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we‚Äôre building the delivery of (almost) everything and you‚Äôll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.

Working at Wolt isn‚Äôt always easy, but it‚Äôs definitely exciting. Here you‚Äôll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You‚Äôll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you‚Äôre a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.

Join our dynamic Operations Analytics Team! As a cornerstone of our organization, this team serves as a one-stop shop for all data analytics needs related to operations and venues. We pride ourselves on our ability to analyze, automate, and guide other teams, functioning as a consultancy/support mechanism. Our work involves close interactions with upper management, contributing significantly to critical strategic discussions. To excel in this role, you must possess a blend of analytical prowess and exceptional communication skills.

What You'll Be Doing


Conducting in-depth analyses using Looker and Excel to support various operational and venue-related teams.
Automating processes to enhance efficiency across departments.
Providing consultancy and support to operational and venue teams to steer their activities based on data-driven insights.
Engaging in regular exchanges with your manager and contributing to strategic decision-making processes.
Preparing reports, occasionally presenting findings through PowerPoint presentations.


Our humble expectations

Must-Haves:


Proficiency in Microsoft Excel
Fluent English skills, both written and verbalStrong analytical skills coupled with the ability to communicate findings effectively.
Ability to work both independently and as part of a collaborative team.
Detail-oriented with excellent organizational skills.
A proactive attitude towards problem-solving and continuous improvement.


Nice-to-Have:


Proficiency in SQL and Python


Why Join Us?

Join us and contribute to driving the success of our operations through insightful analytics and strategic support. If you have the right mix of analytical expertise and communication skills, we would love to hear from you!

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We‚Äôre committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That‚Äôs why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (f/m/x)
Description:
The role

As a Growth Data Analyst in the Growth Analytics team, you will join the wider International Marketing Analytics group which acts as a key consultant for the International part of HelloFresh business. Your main focus will be on supporting your Growth stakeholders in their decision making, and you will be their key contact person regarding data and analytics questions. Your experience with Growth analytics and related technologies, together with your excellent communication, stakeholder management and organizational skills will have a big impact on the company‚Äôs performance.

Above all, we are looking for people who will make HelloFresh better. We believe there are many different ways of developing skills and we love diverse experiences! So even if you don‚Äôt ‚Äútick all the boxes‚Äù but think you‚Äôd thrive in this role, we would really like to learn more about you.

What You‚Äôll Do


Provide cracking insights to optimize marketing campaigns and channel targeting and efficiency
Translate business questions into meaningful analytics for your stakeholders via multiple Growth channels
Creating ad-hoc insights, Lift Tests, AB test analyses, reporting & visualization
Utilise various databases and querying/programming languages to access, manipulate and present the data needed
Improve how we look at Growth Analytics as a group, bringing key analytical insight to various levels across the organization
You will not only take responsibility of own projects, but also be a team player to collaborate and share knowledge with other analysts


What You‚Äôll Bring


Proven experience in Growth Marketing Analytics or any of the following domains: Data Analytics/Business Analytics/Marketing Analytics/Product Analytics/Data Science
3+ years of experience in data analytics and statistical modelling
A degree in Analytics, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or similar quantitative discipline
Expertise in SQL, Python & bigquery with excitement to learn more on the technical side!
Expertise in building dashboards, strong storytelling and visualization skills, we use Tableau
Experience in performing analysis with large datasets and knowing what the common pitfalls are
Analytical and critical thinking combined with good presentation and communication skills
Strong problems solving skills and hands-on & can-do attitude
Marketing or product related experience is highly desirable
Ability to work independently
Experience in statistical modeling, regression, clustering, time series etc is good to have
Preferably experience in working with web analytics (Google Analytics, Meta AA, ADH etc.)
Preferably experience with growth marketing analytics and testing (lift tests, campaign analytics, channel efficiency, AB testing)


What We Offer

Elevate your lifestyle! Join one of Europe's fastest-growing tech powerhouses in a dynamic phase of expansion.


Immerse yourself in a diverse global community of 90+ nationalities.
Enjoy a competitive compensation package that goes beyond the norm, with perks like a HelloFresh- subsidized Pension Scheme, Berlin relocation support, and a Hybrid working model.
Elevate your lifestyle with exclusive discounts on your weekly HelloFresh box and office meals.
Invest in your growth with an annual learning & development budget, German language learning budget, and access to the HelloFresh Academy.
Plus, we've got your well-being covered with mental health support, transportation perks, and working-parent-friendly benefits. From our 24/7 gym access,wellbeing platforms like Headspace and Spill, to sabbatical leave options, HelloFresh is not just a workplace; it's a lifestyle of perks and possibilities!


Are you up for the challenge?

Please submit your complete application below including your salary expectations and earliest starting date.

After submitting an application our team will review this and get back to you within 5 business days.

Title: Senior Data Analyst - People
Description:
As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for a Senior Data Analyst - People to join the People & Culture team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

Join the team that champions the employee experience at Delivery Hero. As part of the People & Culture Team, you‚Äôll help attract, develop, and retain top talent, creating a workplace where people feel valued, supported, and empowered to grow. With each initiative you support, you‚Äôll be building a positive culture that fuels innovation, teamwork, and a sense of belonging across our global organization.

You'll collaborate closely with senior business stakeholders, People & Culture Department leaders, and regional P&C teams from across the world, transforming raw data into actionable intelligence. You‚Äôll analyze people data, identify trends, and develop strategies for optimization. Your work will directly impact decision making at Delivery Hero, fueling organizational performance and enhancements in employee experience with the generation of advanced data insights and predictive intelligence. You‚Äôll be a key contributor to improving our operational excellence and strategic planning.


Develop, maintain and improve analytical pipelines to ensure efficient data processing and reporting
Proactively analyze people data to identify trends and establish key performance metrics to monitor areas for improvement and optimization
Partner with stakeholders to understand their data needs and provide actionable insights
Communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders through clear and concise reports and presentations. Translating technical information into digestible content to drive action plans and decision making.
Raise the bar in the data analysis of employees attrition, org design, efficiency drivers, D&I and other key metrics that bring best practices to the People & Culture department.
Drive data literacy training and upskill people partners and other key stakeholders in the use and understanding of people data.


Qualifications


Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Mathematics, Economics or related field).
Strong critical thinking, ability to deep dive and fully understand patterns in data
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to translate data into actionable insights.
Superior storytelling, ability to write clear and engaging executive summaries with the conclusions of the data analysis produced
Strong business acumen and understanding of key concepts of human resources would be a plus
Familiarity with languages and tools for data manipulation, analysis and plotting (R, R-shiny, R-markdown, Scikit, Numpy/Scipy, Pandas, Matplotlib, Bokeh, Jupyter).


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Data Analyst (Finance working student)
Description:
üë©‚Äçüíªüë®‚Äçüíª About the role

We're looking for an enthusiastic working student to join our fantastic Finance team in the role of Data Analyst. You'll be an integral part of the finance department, primarily supporting the Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) team. Your role will involve close collaboration with commercial and business leaders, providing crucial data-driven insights to inform strategic decision-making.




Your responsibilities will include:

Reporting: Preparing regular and ad hoc reports using internal data base to support business decisions.
Data Analysis and Automation: Collecting, analyzing, and interpreting financial and operational data to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Process improvements: support the improvement of processes and operations in Finance through data-driven approaches
Business Partnering: Working closely with business leaders to understand their financial needs and provide relevant data and insights to support their decision-making.
Special Projects: Participating in and supporting various finance-related projects and initiatives.




Overall, your work will play a key role in enabling data-driven decision-making across the company, contributing to the achievement of strategic objectives and financial goals.




üöß What you‚Äôll do

Assist in daily routines process and decision-making by collecting, processing and analyzing data.
Support automation and optimization in the financial department.
Prepare reports and presentations to support management decisions
Maintain accurate financial records and perform data entry tasks




üèÖWhat you need to succeed

Please note: Do not be put off from applying because you believe you cannot tick every box. If you think you can help, and you really want to join our growing and exciting business please get in touch, we would love to hear from you.

You are currently enrolled as a student in business administration, finance, economics, mathematics or a related field
You have very good skills in Excel and/or Google Sheets
Experience with SQL or data analytics & visualization tools, e.g. Metabase
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
Ability to explain complex topics in a simple way
Proactive mindset and willingness to learn and contribute to real-world projects




üéÅ What's in it for you?

‚Ç¨ 1000 per year for you to contribute to your learning & development to help you grow professionally and personally.
‚Ç¨300 per year for you to endorse team build, including dinners, games, and events.
28 vacation days per year (increasing 1 day every year up to 30).
We welcome you to our office in the center of Berlin 3+ days a week.
Take advantage of our Workation policy, allowing for up to 6 weeks every year of work outside of Germany (some restrictions apply).
Subsidised gym membership to boost your physical and mental well-being.
Tax relief for payments into our Business Bike scheme.
You can accelerate your career and take ownership of your work and development in a flat hierarchy where 360 feedback is encouraged.




ü¶∏ Are you a Monduneer in disguise?

Working in a truly diverse group makes us stronger and more resilient. Furthermore, it enables an unfair advantage - the opportunity to learn from each other, see different perspectives, and consider a broader range of variables in our decision-making. That is what being a Monduneer is all about.




Thus, regardless of your background, age, disability, gender, parental status, race, religion, sexual orientation, educational background, or any other aspect you feel is a statement of your diversity, we look forward to discussing your role in mind.




If you believe you are a Monduneer in disguise, and it's time for you to shine, submit your application, and we'll take it from there.




üíú Meet Mondu

Mondu is changing the B2B payments ecosystem by providing payment solutions that enable any B2B company to grow quickly and safely. We envision a future where businesses, not just consumers, experience a seamless, modern, and human-centered payment flow. Founded by a dream team of passionate entrepreneurs and seasoned tech leaders, Mondu is rapidly scaling. In just two years, we've secured over $120 million in funding, attained an e-money banking license through the Dutch National Bank, and assembled a talented team of over 100 Monduneers across our three locations of Berlin, Amsterdam and London. On the road, we have successfully launched numerous products accessible to buyers in seven markets (and counting!) - catering to thousands of clients.




Our products bring B2B payments up to par with B2C payments: putting the people behind the business at the heart of the payment flow, and ensuring they have a seamless, modern and state-of-the-art experience, whether they are sellers or buyers.




We‚Äôre building a culture at Mondu where amazing people do their best work. If you‚Äôre ready to grow your career and help thousands of organizations pay better, you‚Äôre in the right place.

Title: Data Analyst, Client Onboarding
Description:
Work Location: Berlin or Amsterdam

Are you a skilled Python and SQL user with a strong analytical background? Are you passionate about uncovering insights within data and applying them to real-world financial challenges? Then you might just be the Data Analyst we're looking for!

Your primary responsibilities will be:


Manage the end-to-end process of data-driven knowledge gathering (connect, mine, simulate, predict, illustrate, and deploy)
Create data-based solutions to address complex business challenges
Set up long-term dashboarding and tracking to monitor key metrics
Conduct A/B tests to evaluate and optimize business decisions
Perform deep-dives into socio-economic factors and distribution channels to uncover actionable insights


What we're looking for:


Solid analytical skills (you're a natural problem solver)
Proficiency in Python and SQL (you can write advanced queries with ease)
Solid statistical & technical foundation (e.g., A/B Testing, hypothesis testing) with a self-driven and proactive attitude
Strong verbal and written communication skills (you can explain complex ideas in simple terms)
Focus on quality (you strive for excellence in everything you do)
Knowledge of financial markets & financial products (options, futures, etc.)


What we offer:


Competitive Salary, depending on your educational level and work experience
Free lunch from our cook, fresh juices & fruit
Continuous growth potential and a training budget of ‚Ç¨2,000 per year
Trips & activities with your colleagues
Relaxed and informal working environment
Discount for membership of the Urban Sports Club
Additional contribution to the company pension scheme
In-house German and English courses with a native speaker and cover half of the costs


About us:

LYNX helps you invest in yourself"

"Working at LYNX means joining the LYNX family"

"The development opportunities make LYNX the best place to work"

This is what the employees say about LYNX and it is exactly what we want to offer: a work environment where you can get the best out of yourself. At our office in the heart of Amsterdam, Ghent, Berlin and Prague, we work every day to offer both private and professional clients the best trading opportunities, with a fast, user-friendly and reliable trading platform.

The best choice for anyone who takes investing seriously:

LYNX is an international FinTech that offers you a relaxed and informal work environment, where you can get the best out of yourself and where 300 people contribute together to the success of our customers since 2006.

In 2006 LYNX entered the investor market with two spearheads: very low rates and an extensive product range. This makes the online broker not only successful in the Netherlands, but also abroad. After opening offices in Belgium, Germany and the Czech Republic, LYNX now offers its services in ten different countries, making it a European broker of size.

In 2019 the product of LYNX, and therefore the offer for investors, has been greatly improved. For example, a highly advanced mobile and tablet app is available, the LYNX Masterclass webinars can be watched weekly via the Knowledge Portal, and thanks to the Morning Call, investors are quickly daily informed about the latest news on the financial markets.

Title: Claims Data Analyst/Business Analyst. Healthcare
Description:
Trinetix is seeking analytical and healthcare-savvy Claims Data Analyst / Business Analyst to support projects focused on payer and provider data systems, RCM (Revenue Cycle Management) processes, and data-driven automation initiatives. This role requires a deep understanding of claims data, industry-standard data formats (e.g., 837/835), and the broader healthcare data ecosystem.

The ideal candidate is technology-agnostic, adaptable, and capable of working across systems to analyze trends, identify process gaps, and help implement automated, scalable solutions in healthcare operations.

Requirements


5+ years of experience in a data analysis or business analysis role with a strong focus on claims data.
Solid understanding of 837/835 transaction sets, CPT/ICD coding, adjudication logic, and revenue cycle workflows.
Proven experience working across both payer and provider data systems and data exchange models understanding.
Experience gathering requirements, writing documentation, and conducting business process analysis in healthcare environments.
Familiarity with data querying (SQL) and BI/reporting tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Looker).
Understanding of HIPAA and healthcare data privacy and compliance regulations.


Nice-to-haves


Exposure to FHIR, HL7, or healthcare data interoperability standards.
Experience supporting RCM automation or process improvement projects (e.g., using bots, scripts, or custom workflows).
Familiarity with cloud-based healthcare data platforms or data lakes.
Experience working with clinical and claims data integration use cases.
Bachelor's degree in Healthcare Informatics, Business, Data Science, or a related field.


Core Responsibilities


Develop new features
Analyze requirements and clarify with BSA
Participate in grooming, estimation, and planning sessions
Collaborate with other team members (FE, QA, TDM, BSA, Architect)
Support existing functionality, refactoring, and bug-fixing


Soft Skills


Strong communication and stakeholder engagement skills.
Analytical mindset with attention to detail and data integrity.
Ability to navigate ambiguity and translate complex business needs into clear, actionable requirements.
Collaborative, self-motivated, and solution-oriented.


Why Join Us?


Contribute to meaningful projects that improve healthcare financial operations and data quality.
Work alongside healthcare experts, engineers, and innovators in a dynamic, agile environment.
Be part of a mission-driven team focused on modernizing healthcare data ecosystems. Opportunities for growth, leadership, and cross-functional collaboration


What We Offer


Continuous learning and career growth opportunities
Professional training and English/Spanish language classes
Comprehensive medical insurance
Mental health support
Specialized benefits program with compensation for fitness activities, hobbies, pet care, and more
Flexible working hours
Inclusive and supportive culture


About Us

Established in 2011, Trinetix is a dynamic tech service provider supporting enterprise clients around the world.

Headquartered in Nashville, Tennessee, we have a global team of over 1,000 professionals and delivery centers across Europe, the United States, and Argentina. We partner with leading global brands, delivering innovative digital solutions across Fintech, Professional Services, Logistics, Healthcare, and Agriculture.

Our operations are driven by a strong business vision, a people-first culture, and a commitment to responsible growth. We actively give back to the community through various CSR activities and adhere to international principles for sustainable development and business ethics.

To learn more about how we collect, process, and store your personal data, please review our Privacy Notice: https://www.trinetix.com/corporate-policies/privacy-notice

Title: Growth Data Analyst (Remote Europe)
Description:
n8n is a workflow automation platform that uniquely combines AI capabilities with business process automation. We give technical teams the flexibility of code with the speed of no-code, backed by a passionate community of builders. With 500+ integrations and fair-code principles, we're revolutionizing how businesses connect their systems and processes.

We were founded end of 2019 and currently:


üßë‚Äçü§ù‚Äçüßë We‚Äôre a diverse team of + 120 talented people
üöÄ Our annual recurring revenue is growing over 7x year-over-year
‚≠êÔ∏è With +118k GitHub stars, we are in the top 50 most popular projects of all time on Github
üçæ We were the 25th fastest growing startup last year and 4th BtoB SaaS Rising 100 this year in Europe according to Sifted
üå± We were Sequoia's first seed investment in Germany, and most recently secured our $60M Series B (February '25, led by Highland)


Join n8n to help us unlock the next level of product-led growth through data.

At n8n, we‚Äôre building the most powerful automation platform for technical teams. Our unique blend of low-code flexibility and full-code control gives builders unmatched speed and scalability ‚Äî backed by one of the world‚Äôs most active developer communities. We're building a self-serve motion that‚Äôs already powering millions of automations across companies of all sizes. Now, we‚Äôre looking for a sharp and curious PLG & Growth Data Analyst to help us deeply understand and optimize our self-serve user funnel ‚Äî from acquisition through expansion.

üéØ Your main goal will be to enable data-driven ARR growth by uncovering insights that optimize self-service user acquisition, activation, retention, and expansion.

To get there, here‚Äôs how you‚Äôll make an impact:

üîç Become the expert on our PLG funnel


Understand the current self-serve user journey, from signup to expansion, and map drop-off points.
Own and evolve our PLG funnel analytics to track activation, conversion, retention, and monetization.
Conduct quarterly business reviews and funnel performance analyses to identify trends and risks.


üß™ Power experimentation and growth


Analyze the results of PLG experiments and advise teams on what‚Äôs working ‚Äî and what‚Äôs not.
Continuously refine our PQL definitions based on behavioral signals and user segmentation.
Evaluate pricing plan performance across user segments and surface monetization opportunities.


üõ† Build tools that make data accessible and actionable


Design and maintain dashboards that track self-serve KPIs and enable rapid decision-making.
Build and scale self-service tools and documentation to help teams answer product and growth questions.
Partner with product, marketing, and analytics to ensure shared metrics and clarity across the funnel.


ü§ù Enable cross-functional success


Work closely with Product, Growth, Marketing, and Engineering teams to inform their priorities with data.
Serve as a trusted partner in shaping PLG strategy by identifying new opportunities for activation and expansion.
Champion a culture of experimentation and data-informed decision-making across n8n.


Requirements

Must-haves


üß† PLG/growth analytics experience: You‚Äôve spent 4‚Äì5 years in data roles at high-growth B2B SaaS companies, ideally PLG-led, and know how to interpret behavioral signals and product data.
üìê Experimental mindset: You‚Äôve proposed, designed, and analyzed experiments that drove tangible growth outcomes.
üó£Ô∏è Cross-functional communication: You‚Äôre known for translating complex data into crisp insights that influence Product, Marketing, and Engineering teams.
üßÆ Strong analytical toolkit: You‚Äôre highly proficient in SQL and experienced with BigQuery, DBT, Metabase, and Google Sheets.
ü§ñ Bias for automation & AI: You‚Äôre excited about using automation and AI to streamline workflows and unlock new insights.
üìö Academic foundation: You hold a Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field (e.g. Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, or similar).


Nice-to-haves


üëæ Experience in devtool or community-led growth environments: You understand the unique patterns of usage and activation in technical audiences.
üîß Familiarity with n8n: You‚Äôve used our product ‚Äî or are excited to dive in and explore what makes it so powerful.
üöÄ Startup-first mindset: You‚Äôre energized by ambiguity, fast decision cycles, and the ability to ship impact quickly.
üìä AB testing expertise: You‚Äôve designed and interpreted A/B and multivariate tests in SaaS products with scale.


Why join us?

At n8n, your work won‚Äôt disappear into a slide deck. You'll have direct impact on how we scale our ARR, build our data foundations, and shape the future of product-led growth in one of Europe‚Äôs fastest-growing startups. You‚Äôll join a supportive, remote-first team that values autonomy, experimentation, and continuous learning.

Sound like a challenge you‚Äôre excited to take on?

Apply now ‚Äî and help us build the future of automation.

n8n is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We can sponsor visas to Germany; for any other country, you need to have existing right to work.

Our company language is English.

You care about diversity and inclusion? We do too! Check out our Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging initiatives at n8n (https://www.notion.so/n8n/Diversity-inclusion-and-belonging-n8n-c1bec2fff536422d868b1a438d990e35).

Location disclaimer: If you see multiple job postings for the same role, it is most likely because we're hiring remotely for this role and posting in different locations to make sure every potential candidate can see the role. Please apply to the location you're the most likely to work from in the future.

Benefits


Competitive compensation üí∏ ‚Äì We offer fair and attractive pay.
Ownership üí™ ‚Äì Our core value is to ‚Äúempower others,‚Äù and we mean it‚Äîyou‚Äôll get a slice of n8n with equity.
Work/life balance üèñÔ∏è ‚Äì We work hard but ensure you have time to recharge:
Europe: 30 days of vacation, plus public holidays wherever you are.
US: 15 vacation days, 8 sick days, plus public holidays wherever you are.
Health & wellness ü©∫ ‚Äì
Europe: We provide benefits according to local country norms.*
US: Comprehensive medical (PPO 1200), dental, and vision plans.
Future planning üí∞ ‚Äì
Europe: We provide pension contributions according to local country norms.*
US: 401(k) retirement plan.
Financial security üõ°Ô∏è ‚Äì
Europe: We provide benefits according to local country norms.*
US: Short-term & long-term disability insurance, life & AD&D coverage, and additional hospital coverage.
Career growth üìà ‚Äì We hire rising stars who grow with us! You‚Äôll get ‚Ç¨1K (or equivalent) per year to spend on courses, books, events, or coaching to level up your skills.
A passionate team ü§© ‚Äì We love our product, and we prove it with regular hackathons where we see who can build the coolest thing with it!
Remote-first üåè ‚Äì Our team works remotely across Europe, with regular off-sites for team bonding. Some roles, like sales in the US, are hybrid‚Äîplease check the job description.
Giving back ü§ù ‚Äì We're big fans of open source, and you'll get $100 per month to support projects you care about.
Transparency üôè ‚Äì We all know what everyone‚Äôs working on, how the company is doing‚Äîthe whole shebang.
An ambitious but kind culture üòç ‚Äì People love working here‚Äîour eNPS for 2024 is 94!
Country-specific details are provided in your contract.

  • Understand the current self-serve user journey, from signup to expansion, and map drop-off points.
  • Own and evolve our PLG funnel analytics to track activation, conversion, retention, and monetization.
  • Conduct quarterly business reviews and funnel performance analyses to identify trends and risks.

üß™ Power experimentation and growth

  • Analyze the results of PLG experiments and advise teams on what‚Äôs working ‚Äî and what‚Äôs not.
  • Continuously refine our PQL definitions based on behavioral signals and user segmentation.
  • Evaluate pricing plan performance across user segments and surface monetization opportunities.

üõ† Build tools that make data accessible and actionable

  • Design and maintain dashboards that track self-serve KPIs and enable rapid decision-making.
  • Build and scale self-service tools and documentation to help teams answer product and growth questions.
  • Partner with product, marketing, and analytics to ensure shared metrics and clarity across the funnel.

ü§ù Enable cross-functional success

  • Work closely with Product, Growth, Marketing, and Engineering teams to inform their priorities with data.
  • Serve as a trusted partner in shaping PLG strategy by identifying new opportunities for activation and expansion.
  • Champion a culture of experimentation and data-informed decision-making across n8n.

Requirements

Must-haves

  • üß† PLG/growth analytics experience: You‚Äôve spent 4‚Äì5 years in data roles at high-growth B2B SaaS companies, ideally PLG-led, and know how to interpret behavioral signals and product data.
  • üìê Experimental mindset: You‚Äôve proposed, designed, and analyzed experiments that drove tangible growth outcomes.
  • üó£Ô∏è Cross-functional communication: You‚Äôre known for translating complex data into crisp insights that influence Product, Marketing, and Engineering teams.
  • üßÆ Strong analytical toolkit: You‚Äôre highly proficient in SQL and experienced with BigQuery, DBT, Metabase, and Google Sheets.
  • ü§ñ Bias for automation & AI: You‚Äôre excited about using automation and AI to streamline workflows and unlock new insights.
  • üìö Academic foundation: You hold a Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field (e.g. Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, or similar).

Nice-to-haves

  • üëæ Experience in devtool or community-led growth environments: You understand the unique patterns of usage and activation in technical audiences.
  • üîß Familiarity with n8n: You‚Äôve used our product ‚Äî or are excited to dive in and explore what makes it so powerful.
  • üöÄ Startup-first mindset: You‚Äôre energized by ambiguity, fast decision cycles, and the ability to ship impact quickly.
  • üìä AB testing expertise: You‚Äôve designed and interpreted A/B and multivariate tests in SaaS products with scale.

Why join us?

At n8n, your work won‚Äôt disappear into a slide deck. You'll have direct impact on how we scale our ARR, build our data foundations, and shape the future of product-led growth in one of Europe‚Äôs fastest-growing startups. You‚Äôll join a supportive, remote-first team that values autonomy, experimentation, and continuous learning.

Sound like a challenge you‚Äôre excited to take on?

Apply now ‚Äî and help us build the future of automation.

n8n is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We can sponsor visas to Germany; for any other country, you need to have existing right to work.

Our company language is English.

You care about diversity and inclusion? We do too! Check out our Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging initiatives at n8n (https://www.notion.so/n8n/Diversity-inclusion-and-belonging-n8n-c1bec2fff536422d868b1a438d990e35).

Location disclaimer: If you see multiple job postings for the same role, it is most likely because we're hiring remotely for this role and posting in different locations to make sure every potential candidate can see the role. Please apply to the location you're the most likely to work from in the future.

Benefits

  • Competitive compensation üí∏ ‚Äì We offer fair and attractive pay.
  • Ownership üí™ ‚Äì Our core value is to ‚Äúempower others,‚Äù and we mean it‚Äîyou‚Äôll get a slice of n8n with equity.
  • Work/life balance üèñÔ∏è ‚Äì We work hard but ensure you have time to recharge:
    • Europe: 30 days of vacation, plus public holidays wherever you are.
    • US: 15 vacation days, 8 sick days, plus public holidays wherever you are.
  • Health & wellness ü©∫ ‚Äì
    • Europe: We provide benefits according to local country norms.*
    • US: Comprehensive medical (PPO 1200), dental, and vision plans.
  • Future planning üí∞ ‚Äì
    • Europe: We provide pension contributions according to local country norms.*
    • US: 401(k) retirement plan.
  • Financial security üõ°Ô∏è ‚Äì
    • Europe: We provide benefits according to local country norms.*
    • US: Short-term & long-term disability insurance, life & AD&D coverage, and additional hospital coverage.
  • Career growth üìà ‚Äì We hire rising stars who grow with us! You‚Äôll get ‚Ç¨1K (or equivalent) per year to spend on courses, books, events, or coaching to level up your skills.
  • A passionate team ü§© ‚Äì We love our product, and we prove it with regular hackathons where we see who can build the coolest thing with it!
  • Remote-first üåè ‚Äì Our team works remotely across Europe, with regular off-sites for team bonding. Some roles, like sales in the US, are hybrid‚Äîplease check the job description.
  • Giving back ü§ù ‚Äì We're big fans of open source, and you'll get $100 per month to support projects you care about.
  • Transparency üôè ‚Äì We all know what everyone‚Äôs working on, how the company is doing‚Äîthe whole shebang.
  • An ambitious but kind culture üòç ‚Äì People love working here‚Äîour eNPS for 2024 is 94!
  • Country-specific details are provided in your contract.

Title: Data Analyst, Client Experience
Description:
Work Location: Berlin or Amsterdam

Are you a skilled Python and SQL user with a strong analytical background? Are you passionate about uncovering insights within data and applying them to real-world financial challenges? Then you might just be the Data Analyst we're looking for!

Your primary responsibilities will be:


Manage the end-to-end process of data-driven knowledge gathering (connect, mine, simulate, predict, illustrate, and deploy)
Create data-based solutions to address complex business challenges
Set up long-term dashboarding and tracking to monitor key metrics


What we're looking for:


Solid analytical skills in structured and unstructured data (you're a natural problem solver)
Proficiency in Python and SQL (you can write advanced queries with ease)
A self-driven and proactive attitude
Strong verbal and written communication skills (you can explain complex ideas in simple terms)
Focus on quality (you strive for excellence in everything you do)
Knowledge of financial markets & financial products (options, futures, etc.)


What we offer:


Competitive Salary, depending on your educational level and work experience
Free lunch from our cook, fresh juices & fruit
Continuous growth potential and a training budget of ‚Ç¨2,000 per year
Trips & activities with your colleagues
Relaxed and informal working environment
Discount for membership of the Urban Sports Club
Additional contribution to the company pension scheme
In-house German and English courses with a native speaker and cover half of the costs


About us:

LYNX helps you invest in yourself"

"Working at LYNX means joining the LYNX family"

"The development opportunities make LYNX the best place to work"

This is what the employees say about LYNX and it is exactly what we want to offer: a work environment where you can get the best out of yourself. At our office in the heart of Amsterdam, Ghent, Berlin and Prague, we work every day to offer both private and professional clients the best trading opportunities, with a fast, user-friendly and reliable trading platform.

The best choice for anyone who takes investing seriously:

LYNX is an international FinTech that offers you a relaxed and informal work environment, where you can get the best out of yourself and where 300 people contribute together to the success of our customers since 2006.

In 2006 LYNX entered the investor market with two spearheads: very low rates and an extensive product range. This makes the online broker not only successful in the Netherlands, but also abroad. After opening offices in Belgium, Germany and the Czech Republic, LYNX now offers its services in ten different countries, making it a European broker of size.

In 2019 the product of LYNX, and therefore the offer for investors, has been greatly improved. For example, a highly advanced mobile and tablet app is available, the LYNX Masterclass webinars can be watched weekly via the Knowledge Portal, and thanks to the Morning Call, investors are quickly daily informed about the latest news on the financial markets.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
About Safe

Safe is redefining the future of self-custodial onchain treasury management. It currently holds $>60B+ in onchain assets. Safe{Wallet} web and mobile is the de-facto standard for crypto native organizations, individuals and groups to co-manage assets via Multi-sig.

Safe{Wallet} infrastructure is widely used by developers integrating Safe. It is used for multi-million dollar treasury operations and governance by top protocols like World, Aave, Balancer and Gnosis. With more innovations in security and user experience, Safe is poised exponential growth in DeFi and onchain asset management.

üíª About the role:

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will unlock deep, actionable insights from both on-chain and off-chain data sources to guide strategic decisions across the business and product teams. Embedded in a cross-functional EPD team of ~30 people, you will directly influence pricing, feature development, and go-to-market strategies in a rapidly evolving Web3 environment.

üóÉÔ∏è What you will be doing:


Analyze complex data (on-chain & off-chain) to drive business and product insights
Build and maintain dashboards and reporting tools that communicate clear narratives
Define and track key performance indicators across product and business functions
Collaborate with data engineers to ensure reliable pipelines and scalable analytics infrastructure
Conduct A/B tests and statistical analyses to validate product changes
Support product, strategy, and growth teams with tailored, high-impact analytics


üéí What you will bring:


Proven experience in product or revenue analytics within fintech, web3 or digital product companies
Strong SQL and data modeling skills
Expertise in experimentation frameworks and statistical testing
Fluency with defining KPIs, data visualization and dashboarding
Hands-on familiarity with blockchain analytics platforms (Dune, Etherscan, etc.)
Experience with Python and cloud platforms (AWS/GCP)


Core competencies


Data-Driven Improver: You use data and testing to drive improvements and guide decisions.
Engaged Communicator: You translate data into clear, actionable insights.
Pragmatic Executor: You prioritize results and deliver even in ambiguity.
Cross-Functional Collaborator: You understand and align with stakeholder needs.
Curious & Web3-Savvy: You explore new blockchain tools and trends.
Autonomous & Accountable: You own your work from start to finish.


üéÅ What we can offer you:


üíª Home Working Budget: Personalize your home office with a dedicated budget! Choose from a sleek desk, top-notch headphones, a comfy chair, and more. We're committed to creating a workspace that inspires you.
üèùÔ∏è 30 vacation days as standard: Take the time off you need no matter where you work. All of our contributors get 30 vacation days by default, with public holidays in addition.
üìö Continuous Learning: Invest in yourself with our personal education and conference budgets. Stay ahead of the curve by attending conferences, workshops, and courses that align with your professional growth.
üé® Innovative Fridays: Unleash your creativity! Spend Friday afternoons diving into research or working on a side project within our exciting ecosystem. It's the perfect opportunity to explore new ideas and contribute to innovative endeavours.
‚åõ Flexible Work Schedules: Embrace work-life balance with our flexible working schedules. We understand that everyone has unique needs, and our hybrid work policies empower you to choose a working style that suits you best.


Please apply with your English resume.

Variety is the spice of life and a celebrated component of our culture. At Safe, we strive to create an inclusive environment that empowers our employees. We believe that our products and services benefit from our diverse backgrounds and experiences and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer: all qualified applicants are considered for positions regardless of race, ethnic origin, age, religion or belief, marital status, gender identification, sexual orientation, or physical ability.

Title: Data Analyst - Product (d/f/m)
Description:
Our Story

Every year millions of people are either filing their taxes in fear or giving up on their tax refund altogether. We're working on fixing that. Our intuitive app enables anyone, regardless of education or background, to file their taxes with newfound confidence.

Spread across Germany, Spain and the UK, the team at Taxfix Group with its brands Taxfix, Steuerbot and TaxScouts, is a compassionate group of solution-finders. We speak our minds openly, and with over 400 professionals, including tax experts, developers, and IT security experts, we're rich in ideas and voices. The group has facilitated more than 3.5 billion euros in tax refunds for its customers since its founding in 2016

Your Challenge

As a Data Analyst in our Product Analytics team, you will play a key role in shaping data-informed decision-making across multiple mission teams.

Partnering with Product Managers, Engineers, Designers, and other cross-functional stakeholders, you will use data to uncover insights about user behavior across both our customer-facing products and internal tools.

Your work will involve designing and building reports, analyzing feature performance, generating actionable insights that drive product improvements, and contributing to a robust data foundation by helping define and structure the right tracking and data capture.

Your Responsibilities


Analyze user behavior and product usage to uncover trends, pain points, and opportunities.
Define and track key product metrics to measure feature performance and business impact.
Translate complex data into clear, compelling narratives and share insights with a range of stakeholders.
Build dashboards to enable self-serve analytics across the organization, and also up-skill your stakeholders.
Collaborate with the Analytics Engineering to improve our data sources and self-serve solution.


Your Profile


2+ years of experience in a data analytics role, ideally within a product or tech environment
Ability to translate complex data into clear insights and actionable recommendations.
Good communication skills and ability to work with stakeholders across all levels.
Excellent SQL skills.
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Mixpanel, Tableau).
Keen interest in AI‚Äôs potential, paired with hands-on experimentation and solid conceptual understanding of generative-AI tools.


Nice To Have


Experience with A/B testing and Python are plus.
Data modelling and dbt knowledge are a plus.


Why Taxfix?


A chance to do meaningful, people-centric work with an international team of passionate professionals.
Holistic well-being with free mental health coaching sessions and yoga.
A monthly allowance to spend on an extensive range of services that you can use and roll over as flexibly as you like.
Employee stock options for all employees‚Äîbecause everyone deserves to benefit from the success they help to create.
30 annual vacation days and flexible working hours.
A generous learning budget to support your personal and professional development and guidance from our internal L&D experts.
Work from abroad for up to six weeks every year. Just align with your team, and then enjoy your trip.
Plenty of opportunities to socialise as a team. In addition to internal tech meetups, our international team hosts regular get-togethers‚Äîvirtually and in person when possible.
Free tax declaration filing, of course, through the Taxfix app‚Äîand internal support for all personal tax-related questions.
Have a four-legged friend in your life? We‚Äôre happy to have dogs join us in the office.


Excited? So are we. Learn more about Team Taxfix on our blog and get a glimpse of our culture.

At Taxfix, we believe that incredible things happen when you have a wealth of perspectives and experiences. We're proudly committed to equal employment and development opportunities no matter your gender, race, religion, age, sexual orientation, colour, disability, or place of origin. To help mitigate any potential unconscious biases, we ask that you refrain from including your picture, age, or marital status on your CV. Let your experiences speak for themselves.

Not sure if you meet all the requirements for this role? Please apply anyway. You might bring something special to the team that we hadn't considered previously.

Title: Staff Product Analyst, Adtech
Description:
As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for a Staff Product Analyst to join the Adtech tribe on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

We work on developing digital advertising solutions for our vendors. Currently, these solutions are available on our food ordering platform, both on mobile and the web. The Ad Tech solutions support the vendors in all three steps of the marketing funnel: awareness, consideration, and conversion enabling them to achieve sustainable growth on our platform.

A Product Analyst in the Ad Tech organization plays a pivotal role in enabling data-driven decision-making. You will have end-to-end ownership of data: define and implement tracking requirements, set up A/B tests, analyze large datasets to provide actionable insights on the performance of different revenue streams, and communicate the results to relevant stakeholders.

You will be a critical member in defining the product strategy and the continued success of our brands.

If you're a creative problem solver who is hungry for a new adventure, an international workplace is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!


Drive data mindset in the team, guide in terms of methodology, support and execute testing, and be a quality gatekeeper on data leading to product decisions
Develop in-depth analytical understanding for what drives growth for the product and how it can be improved
Leverage insights from data by providing analyses, reports and dashboards for product management and other departments
Use quantitative analysis and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand what drives our business, providing insights to help product managers, designers, and engineers to decide which features to build and why
Work with structured and semi-structured data from different data sources and different products


Qualifications


Overall 6+ years of experience, preferably in e-commerce
You've completed a degree in statistics, mathematics, economics, computer science or an equivalent education or possess relevant practical experience
Very good communication skills in English, both written and oral
Data Analysis: Strong experience in SQL (BigQuery) and Python (alternatively R)
A/B Testing: Experience designing experiments and analyzing results with a solid background in statistics
Data Visualization Technologies: Preferably Tableau or similar alternatives e.g. Looker, QlikView, etc.


Nice to have:


Tracking Technologies: Google Analytics or similar alternatives e.g. Adobe Analytics/Omniture, SnowPlow, etc.
Industry expertise in advertising and/or marketing.


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.
Show more
HTML:
As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for a Staff Product Analyst to join the Adtech tribe on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

We work on developing digital advertising solutions for our vendors. Currently, these solutions are available on our food ordering platform, both on mobile and the web. The Ad Tech solutions support the vendors in all three steps of the marketing funnel: awareness, consideration, and conversion enabling them to achieve sustainable growth on our platform.

A Product Analyst in the Ad Tech organization plays a pivotal role in enabling data-driven decision-making. You will have end-to-end ownership of data: define and implement tracking requirements, set up A/B tests, analyze large datasets to provide actionable insights on the performance of different revenue streams, and communicate the results to relevant stakeholders.

You will be a critical member in defining the product strategy and the continued success of our brands.

If you're a creative problem solver who is hungry for a new adventure, an international workplace is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!

  • Drive data mindset in the team, guide in terms of methodology, support and execute testing, and be a quality gatekeeper on data leading to product decisions
  • Develop in-depth analytical understanding for what drives growth for the product and how it can be improved
  • Leverage insights from data by providing analyses, reports and dashboards for product management and other departments
  • Use quantitative analysis and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand what drives our business, providing insights to help product managers, designers, and engineers to decide which features to build and why
  • Work with structured and semi-structured data from different data sources and different products

Qualifications

  • Overall 6+ years of experience, preferably in e-commerce
  • You've completed a degree in statistics, mathematics, economics, computer science or an equivalent education or possess relevant practical experience
  • Very good communication skills in English, both written and oral
  • Data Analysis: Strong experience in SQL (BigQuery) and Python (alternatively R)
  • A/B Testing: Experience designing experiments and analyzing results with a solid background in statistics
  • Data Visualization Technologies: Preferably Tableau or similar alternatives e.g. Looker, QlikView, etc.

Nice to have:

  • Tracking Technologies: Google Analytics or similar alternatives e.g. Adobe Analytics/Omniture, SnowPlow, etc.
  • Industry expertise in advertising and/or marketing.

Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.

  • Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
  • We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
  • We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
  • Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
  • Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
  • The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.

Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: (Senior) Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
FIXING THE PLANET BY MAKING HOMES CARBON-FREE!

With ‚Ç¨35 million in funding from top-tier investors such as COATUE, Foundamental & Target Global, we are working towards a future where climate-neutral buildings - simply & rapidly - become a reality. At Enter, we aggregate and analyze relevant building data so that homeowners can sustainably reduce their energy costs and increase the value of their property.

We Believe In


Common code access
No gatekeepers
Simplicity over industry standards
Embracing the small change
Baked in quality


We‚Äôre looking for people with an entrepreneurial mindset who enjoy having the freedom to directly own and impact parts of the Enter product.

Deine Aufgaben


Create and maintain dashboards and related KPIs, work with data engineers on data quality observability and incident monitoring to ensure our reporting infrastructure is as reliable as our engineering infrastructure
Work with stakeholders to not only understand the processes that generate data but serve as a sparring partner to design them with data analytics in mind
Manage the lifecycle of all data products in our visualization tool Metabase, including decommissioning unused dashboards, aiming for less than 5% unused dashboards weekly.
You not only provide your working groups with the necessary insights but proactively drive processes to rely on data.
Ensure the Metabase structure is organized and easy to navigate.
Take responsibility for the correctness of data, regardless of the origin of any issues.
Be a key resource for team members to improve their ability to read and interpret data effectively.


Dein Profil


You have extensive experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role, maintaining dashboards and KPIs (5+ years of experience)
You have advanced proficiency in managing data products in Metabase or similar platforms.
Experience with Product Analytic tools like Amplitude and Event based reportings is a plus.
You have a strong understanding of data lifecycle management, including cleaning up and decommissioning unused assets.
You have analytical skills and pay attention to detail, with a focus on data accuracy and quality.
You have excellent communication and collaboration skills to support crew leads and team members in understanding and using data.
You have the ability to combine technical data expertise with domain-specific knowledge.
You are fluent in English (German is a plus, but not required).


Benefits


Become part of one of Europe's fastest growing Climate Tech Startups - funded by Europe's best known VC's.
Attractive & competitive compensation.
Work with top talent in a dynamic environment.
Individual benefits: learning budget, Urban Sports Clubs membership, job ticket or daycare allowance.
Office with a direct view of the Spree River, with everything your heart desires.
Numerous team events, including weekly yoga.


If this role sounds like a great fit for you, we‚Äôd love to hear from you! Please send us your CV. As part of the interview process, you can expect a short case to give us a sense of how you approach challenges relevant to the role.

√úber uns

Wir setzen auf eine offene und transparente Kommunikation und arbeiten im Austausch auf Augenh√∂he mit kurzen Entscheidungswegen. Leidenschaft, Ambition, Optimismus und Transparenz treiben uns t√§glich an!

Title: Sales Operations Data Analyst / BI Specialist (w/m/d)
Description:
Unternehmensbeschreibung

Unser Ziel ist eine Solaranlage auf jedem Dach, ein Speicher in jedem Haus, und ein E-Auto in jeder Garage. Wie wir das schaffen? Enpal macht Solar endlich einfach: Wir vermieten Solaranlagen, Stromspeicher und Wallboxen zum All-inclusive-Tarif, erg√§nzt um einen g√ºnstigen √ñkostromtarif, und intelligent vernetzt zu einer integrierten Gesamtl√∂sung.

Auf unserem Weg zum gr√∂√üten Energieunternehmen Europas stehen wir gerade erst am Anfang. Deshalb sind wir auf der Suche nach Talenten, die uns auf diesem Weg begleiten, ihren Fu√üabdruck hinterlassen und Erfolge gemeinsam mit uns feiern. Bei uns findest Du ein dynamisches Arbeitsumfeld, genauso wie den Raum, Dich pers√∂nlich und fachlich weiterzuentwickeln und Deine St√§rken wirkungsvoll einzusetzen.

Als erstes gr√ºnes Unicorn in Deutschland und wachstumsst√§rkstes Energieunternehmen in Europa (FT1000 Ranking 2022 von Financial Times & Statista) treiben wir unsere Mission von gr√ºner Energie f√ºr alle weiter voran. Sei auch Du Teil dieser Erfolgsgeschichte und ver√§ndere mit uns gemeinsam die Welt!

Stellenbeschreibung


Eigenverantwortliche Bereitstellung und Modellierung von vertriebsrelevanten Daten in Snowflake
Aufbau, Pflege und Optimierung von Datenpipelines zur Integration und Transformation von Daten aus unterschiedlichen Quellsystemen
Erstellung, Pflege und Weiterentwicklung von interaktiven Dashboards und Reports in Power BI zur Unterst√ºtzung datengetriebener Entscheidungen im Vertrieb
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit Sales, Marketing und Finance zur Erhebung von Reporting-Anforderungen
Entwicklung von KPIs und Analysen zur Performance-Messung und Identifikation von Wachstumspotenzialen
Sicherstellung von Datenqualit√§t, -verf√ºgbarkeit und -konsistenz
Mitwirkung bei der Weiterentwicklung der BI-Infrastruktur und Tools im Unternehmen



Qualifikationen


Abgeschlossenes Studium in Wirtschaftsinformatik, Statistik, Data Science, BWL oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation
Mindestens 2 Jahre Berufserfahrung im Bereich Business Intelligence, Data Analytics oder Sales Operations
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in SQL und praktische Erfahrung mit Snowflake (Datenmodellierung, Performance Tuning, Datenaufbereitung)
Fundierte Erfahrung in der Erstellung und Visualisierung von Dashboards mit Tableau
Erfahrung im Umgang mit ETL-Prozessen und Datenintegration
Analytisches Denkverm√∂gen, eigenverantwortliche Arbeitsweise und hohe Kommunikationsf√§higkeit
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse



Zus√§tzliche Informationen


Arbeite in Deutschlands erstem gr√ºnen Unicorn und gestalte aktiv die solare Energiewende mit.
Die Sonne scheint auf der ganzen Welt - Bei Enpal findest du ein hochmotiviertes und diverses Team, mit mehr als 65 verschiedenen Nationalit√§ten.
Wir erf√ºllen jedes Startup-Klischee - In unserem modernen Office in Berlin-Friedrichshain findest du von Tischtennisplatte und Yoga-Ecke bis Dachterrasse und gef√ºllten Getr√§nkek√ºhlschr√§nken alles was das Herz begehrt.
Dein Kick-start bei Enpal - Lerne an deinem Onboarding-Tag das Unternehmen, deine Teamkolleg*innen und unseren Gr√ºnder Mario kennen.
Bleib auf dem Laufenden - Egal ob Unternehmenszahlen bei unseren monatlichen All-Hands-Meetings oder die Funktionsweise einer Photovoltaikanlage beim Lunch & Learn, du wei√üt immer genau Bescheid.
Energiewende geht nur gemeinsam ‚Äì Bei Enpal erwartet dich ein legend√§rer Teamspirit und unvergessliche Teamevents.
Ohne Fehler kein Fortschritt ‚Äì Wir leben eine starke Feedback-Kultur und wachsen mit deinem Input.



Wir bei Enpal sind stolz auf die Vielf√§ltigkeit unseres Teams. Weder bei der Einstellung noch w√§hrend des Besch√§ftigungsverh√§ltnisses werden Entscheidungen auf Basis von Hautfarbe, Religion oder religi√∂sen Glaubens, ethnischer oder nationaler Herkunft, Nationalit√§t, Geschlechteridentit√§t, sexuelle Orientierung, Behinderung oder Alter getroffen. Enpal steht f√ºr einen sicheren Arbeitsplatz und geht gegen Diskriminierung und Bel√§stigung jeglicher Art vor.

Title: Data Analyst (Marketing & CRM Focus)
Description:
Blinkist connects people with powerful ideas from leading authors and experts to broaden perspectives, gain knowledge, and spark understanding in all areas of their life, both personal and professional.




Used by over 32 million people worldwide, Blinkist distills the key ideas from the most relevant, impactful books and podcasts. These can be read or listened to in 15-minute summaries, that we call Blinks. ‚ú®




About The Role

We're looking for a Data Analyst with a passion for data-driven decision-making to join our team. In this role, you‚Äôll design, develop, optimize and finally use data transformation pipelines to derive actionable insights that drive business impact. For us, data is a means to an end: Making better decisions together with the business stakeholders and help them achieve better results.




Please note this is a 1-year limited contract position.




Check out the hiring process for this position here: https://jobs.blinkist.com/vm4 üöÄ




What You'll Do

Drive Conversion Strategy: Partner with the CRM team to analyze user behavior, identify conversion opportunities, and design data-driven campaigns that move free users to paid subscriptions and paid users to enterprise accounts.
Campaign Design & Execution: Go beyond analysis‚Äîactively participate in campaign planning, A/B test design, and optimization strategies. Your insights will directly shape how we engage our users.
User Lifecycle Analytics: Build a deep understanding of user journeys, identify drop-off points, and create actionable recommendations that improve conversion rates at every stage.
Performance Optimization: Monitor campaign performance, conduct post-campaign analysis, and iterate on strategies. Turn data into clear action items that drive measurable business results.
Stakeholder Partnership: Work closely with marketing, product, and CRM teams to align data insights with business objectives. Translate complex analysis into clear, actionable recommendations.




What We're Looking For

Data Enthusiasm: You have a passion for clean, well-structured data and the curiosity to explore and find impactful solutions.
Strong SQL Skills: You write SQL like a second language, with experience building complex queries and optimizing performance.
Hands-on Experience with dbt: You‚Äôve successfully used dbt to build and maintain data pipelines, ensuring data is reliable and accessible.
You want to achieve results, together: You want to see the outcome of your work. You‚Äôre not afraid to deprioritize ‚Äúbusy-work‚Äù and you love to succeed as a team.
Business Impact Mindset: You approach technical challenges with a focus on driving business results and solving real-world problems.
Collaborative Spirit: You thrive in team settings, working with others to align on goals and deliver results.
Growth Mindset: You embrace challenges, learn quickly, and seek opportunities to grow personally and professionally.




Great to Haves:

Experience with CRM platforms (especially Braze) and marketing automation tools
A/B testing and experimentation experience
Familiarity with user behavior analytics tools
Understanding of subscription business models and enterprise sales




Why Blinkist

Our unique culture of empowerment, mutual respect, and transparency has always been our defining characteristic. We support each other and carve out opportunities for every individual to develop and grow. We strongly believe that diversity powers innovation, thus we celebrate and support our differences, providing equal opportunities for employment and career growth. We embrace a flexible, remote-friendly way of working that supports different needs and lifestyles.




These are some of our most valued benefits:

30 PTO days + Wellbeing days + Learning days
Flexible approach to work, including from abroad
Monthly transport allowance
One-time work from home office set up budget
Professional development fund
Family planning & parental leave, plus support for parents returning to work
Wellness initiatives and an Employee Assistance Program




If you choose to join our team in Berlin, you'll have access to our modern office space in Neuk√∂lln and enjoy healthy plant-based meals prepared fresh every day by our very own chef. ü•ë




Apply Now

If we‚Äôve captured your interest and you want to take part in changing the world through the power of ideas, apply now and tell us what excited you about this opportunity.




We look forward to hearing from you! ‚òÄÔ∏è




üîé Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, women and other marginalised folks tend to only apply when they check every box. If you think you have what it takes, even if you don't meet every single point on the job description, please still get in touch. We‚Äôd love to review your application and see if you could be a great fit.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
About This Position

Are you passionate about turning raw data into strategic insights that drive business success? Do you thrive in a fast-paced startup environment where you have the autonomy to shape and scale data infrastructure?

They heyData is your next stop!

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in managing our data infrastructure, developing scalable data models, and providing actionable insights to teams across the company. You'll ensure data-driven decision-making and foster a data-first culture.

Your mission


Manage & Optimize BI Infrastructure: Own and maintain our end-to-end BI setup, which currently includes Airbyte, dbt, Snowflake, and Metabase. Continuously evaluate and implement the best tools to meet our evolving needs.
Develop Scalable Data Models: Build and maintain reliable, scalable data models that ensure data integrity and accuracy across all business functions.
Drive Strategic Insights: Analyze business performance metrics, identify trends, and provide actionable recommendations to leadership and various teams.
Cross-Team Collaboration: Work closely with engineering, product, marketing, and sales teams to understand data needs and support data-driven decision-making.
Mentorship & Alignment: Manage and upskill junior team members and ensure that data strategies align with the company‚Äôs vision and goals.
Ensure Data Governance: Implement and uphold data governance policies and industry best practices to maintain compliance and security.


What we are looking for?


5+ years of experience in Business Intelligence, Data Analytics, or a related field.Strong proficiency in SQL and experience working with relational databases (PostgreSQL, Snowflake, Redshift, etc.).
Hands-on experience with BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Metabase, or similar.
Knowledge of data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing concepts.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate data into meaningful business insights.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex data clearly to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience with dbt is a plus.
Good knowledge of Python or R for data analysis is a plus.
Experience in a startup or fast-paced environment is a plus.


Why heyData?


Your growth matters: Clear development paths, an annual & flexible learning budget, and real trust in your ideas.
Work the way that works for you: Remote, from our Berlin office, or hybrid - you decide where you‚Äôre most productive.
Time for yourself: 30 vacation days, flexible working hours, and a work culture that values focus time and supports your productivity.
State-of-the-art equipment : A MacBook & Co. to help you get started quickly
On top of that, we support in your Benefits: Urban Sports Club membership, the Deutschlandticket, a company pension plan, and more.
Team spirit that sticks: Offsites, regular team events, and honest, transparent communication on equal footing.
Be yourself: Diversity makes us stronger ‚Äì no matter where you‚Äôre from, how you identify, or where you are in life.


About Us

At heyData, we are determined to serve our mission: making Compliance easy for everybody!

At heyData, we're not just a company; we're a movement. We're reshaping the way small and medium-sized businesses embrace compliance. We set up European employees on track to reach compliance in the fastest, most intuitive, and seamless way possible. Think of us as the superheroes of compliance, and we've only just begun. With over one thousand customers we are one of the largest SMB compliance platforms in Europe and are expanding further.

But here's the real kicker ‚Äì you get to learn from a world-class team across Europe and contribute to a game-changing compliance solution that's set to revolutionize millions of SMBs. So, are you ready to be part of this incredible journey and do the most exciting work of your life? Let's make compliance history together! #heyDataLife

If the idea of making an impact excites you as much as it does us, then heyData is where you belong. This is your chance to leap into the adventure of a lifetime and set your career on fire! Reach out to us, and let's blaze a trail together in the world of business innovation! #JoinheyData

At heyData, we're proud to be a vibrant and diverse startup. We celebrate and embrace people from all backgrounds, including diverse gender, age, sexuality, religion, ethnicity, disability status parental status, and more to apply to our roles. Our team thrives on the unique perspectives and experiences that each person brings. We're committed to fostering an inclusive and supportive environment where everyone can succeed. The more diverse and inclusive we are as a team, the greater our work will be.
