Title: Professional Data Entry Operator
Description:
This is a remote position.

Job Title: Professional Data Entry Operator


Location: United States (Remote)


Company: CityGreen Services





Overview:


CityGreen Services is a leading provider of lawn care and landscaping services in the greater metropolitan area. We are currently seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented Professional Data Entry Operator to join our growing team. If you have a passion for accuracy and efficiency in data management, and want to be a part of a dynamic and fast-paced company, then this is the perfect job for you!


Pay: $29.34 - $34.67 per hour


Key Responsibilities:


- Accurately entering data and maintaining data integrity in various software programs


- Creating and updating spreadsheets and databases with information provided by team members


- Collaborating with team members to ensure accurate and timely data entry


- Reviewing and verifying data for errors and correcting as needed


- Organizing and maintaining physical and digital files in a structured and accessible manner


- Assisting in the development and implementation of data entry processes and procedures


- Supporting other team members with data-related tasks and projects as needed


- Keeping up-to-date with industry standards and best practices for data entry and management





Qualifications:





- High school diploma or equivalent required, associate or bachelor's degree preferred


- Proven experience in data entry and management, preferably in a fast-paced and deadline-driven environment


- Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and experience with data entry software programs


- Excellent attention to detail and strong organizational skills


- Ability to multi-task and prioritize tasks effectively


- Strong verbal and written communication skills


- Able to work independently and in a team setting


- Flexibility and adaptability to changing priorities and tasks


- Knowledge of lawn care and landscaping industry is a plus


- Must be able to pass a background check and drug test





Why Work for CityGreen Services:





At CityGreen Services, we believe in creating a positive and supportive work environment for our employees. We offer competitive salaries, benefits packages, and opportunities for growth and advancement within the company. In addition, we value and support work-life balance for our employees.





We also take pride in our commitment to sustainability and community involvement. As a leading provider of lawn care and landscaping services, we strive to make a positive impact on the environment and the communities we serve.





Join our team of dedicated professionals and grow your career with CityGreen Services!





Application Process:





To apply for the position of Professional Data Entry Operator, please submit your resume and cover letter outlining your qualifications and experience. Only successful applicants will be contacted for an interview.





CityGreen Services is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes candidates from diverse backgrounds and abilities to apply. We are committed to providing a positive and inclusive work environment for all employees.





Requirements



- High school diploma or equivalent required, associate or bachelor's degree preferred


- Proven experience in data entry and management, preferably in a fast-paced and deadline-driven environment


- Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and experience with data entry software programs


- Excellent attention to detail and strong organizational skills


- Ability to multi-task and prioritize tasks effectively


- Strong verbal and written communication skills


- Able to work independently and in a team setting


- Flexibility and adaptability to changing priorities and tasks


- Knowledge of lawn care and landscaping industry is a plus


- Must be able to pass a background check and drug test

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Summary

Our client is seeking a Data Analyst to join their team! This position is remote.

Duties


Help influence and implement an end-to-end vision for how production data can be presented within an analysis platform
Investigate short term problems, and long term data needs with thorough investigation, clear presentation of findings, demonstrating strong skills in python and SQL
Partner with supply chain to define, document, implement and maintain business processes and data workflows
Develop data visualizations and drive reporting solutions based on feedback from Engineers, PCIT Developers and End Users needs
Recommend visualization platforms for reports based on requirements, platform capabilities and best fit
Help our engineers and PCIT developers create data reports for business, gathering requirements and investigating needs
Work with the manager, regional automation or process engineers depending on the site


Desired Skills/Experience:


Experience in managing and communicating complex projects and collaborating with cross functional teams to accomplish project goals within expected timelines
Knowledge on data governance concepts and implementation
Experience in data analytics, change management and data modeling
Proficient in SQL, MSSQL, Python
ETL experience with different ranges of technology
Denodo/Data virtualization experience preferred
Knowledgeable on deployment process flow concepts
Experience with tableau server/desktop/prep setup and dashboard building
Strong initiative, results orientation, and able to work independently with minimal direction
Demonstrated ability to see differing perspectives and work cross-functionally
Good communication skills, written and verbal, is required


Benefits:


Medical, Dental, & Vision Insurance Plans
401K offered


$49.00 - $69.00 (est. hourly rate)

Title: Data Analyst Intern (Internship)
Description:
Verified Job On Employer Career Site




Job Summary:

Danfoss is seeking a Data Analyst Intern who will assist with transforming customer complaints and warranty data into reports that drive business decisions. The role involves cleaning and analyzing data, building dashboards, and developing predictive models to support continuous improvement initiatives.




Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Clean, transform, and analyze data files using Microsoft Excel, including pivot tables, Power Query, Scripts, Macros, and advanced formulas

‚Ä¢ Build and maintain Power BI dashboards to track customer complaints, and quality performance indicators

‚Ä¢ Research, develop, and explore hidden patterns through analysis of large data sets

‚Ä¢ Develop algorithms and predictive models, validate models and measure performance

‚Ä¢ Support continuous improvement initiatives aimed at reducing line & field failures, increasing customer satisfaction




Qualifications:




Required:

‚Ä¢ Pursuing a Bachelor or Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science, and Engineering

‚Ä¢ Microsoft Power Automate and Office Suite skill

‚Ä¢ Proficient in Power BI for visual storytelling and KPIs

‚Ä¢ Strong skills in Excel for data modeling and transformation

‚Ä¢ Analytical mindset with strong attention to details

‚Ä¢ Experience with machine learning tools (e.g., Python, R, or ML platforms)




Preferred:

‚Ä¢ Experience working with large datasets and databases

‚Ä¢ Preparing reports for the management stating trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data




Company:

Danfoss engineers solutions that increase machine productivity, reduce emissions, lower energy consumption, and enable electrification. Founded in 1933, the company is headquartered in Nordborg, Syddanmark, DNK, with a team of 10001+ employees. The company is currently Late Stage.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst - Tableau - Remote US
Description:
Lensa is a career site that helps job seekers find great jobs in the US. We are not a staffing firm or agency. Lensa does not hire directly for these jobs, but promotes jobs on LinkedIn on behalf of its direct clients, recruitment ad agencies, and marketing partners. Lensa partners with DirectEmployers to promote this job for SitusAMC. Clicking "Apply Now" or "Read more" on Lensa redirects you to the job board/employer site. Any information collected there is subject to their terms and privacy notice.

SitusAMC is where the best and most passionate people come to transform our client‚Äôs businesses and their own careers. Whether you‚Äôre a real estate veteran, a passionate technologist, or looking to get your start, join us as we work together to realize opportunities for everyone, we proudly serve.

At SitusAMC, we are looking to match your unique experience with one of our amazing careers, so that we can help you realize your potential and career growth within the Real Estate Industry. If you are someone who can be yourself, advocate for others, stay nimble, dream big, own every outcome, and think global but act local ‚Äì come join our team!

This role is responsible for the building and ongoing delivery of SitusAMC‚Äôs enterprise business intelligence strategy. The position builds the processes involved in business intelligence. They build the technology to disperse critical information and insights to the organization and clients. Working closely with business leaders, vendors and client service managers, the position captures business requirements, creates and administers dashboards, and reviews others ensure a quality product. This role will have demonstratable experience expanding and building a global Information Technology-based reporting and business intelligence platform. This role may build and mentor other report developers to extract critical information from operational systems and data lakes and data warehouses, expanding the availability of data and information throughout the organization. They will partner closely with other Data, Reporting, and Analytics teams to insure the efficient, accurate and relevant presentation of information.

Essential Job Functions


Under direction, partner with business and technology team members to expand the business intelligence platform.
Follow the software development lifecycle of the business intelligence platform.
Create complex t-SQL statements and stored procedures and queries to extract data.
Build dashboards, data extracts, and visualizations.
Mentor and review junior staff quality of work.
Prompt and regular attendance is required.
Other activities as may be assigned by your manager.


Qualifications/ Requirements


College degree or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Mid-level professional with 2-4 years of industry and/or relevant experience, typically at an Analyst level role or external equivalent.
Proficient building t-SQL statement is required, preferably in MySQL or MSSQL.
Proficiency in Tableau is required.
Proficient with Excel and Microsoft Office Suite.
Strong time management and communication skills (written and oral).
Strong analytical ability, good judgment; strategic and multidimensional thinker.
Detail oriented, organized; prompt and regular attendance is required.
Continuous learner; excitement in personal growth and development.
Strong commitment and dedication to the position and a team player.


Note: This job description is not intended to be all inclusive or exclusive. At any time, employees may perform other related duties as required to meet the ongoing needs of the organization and participate in additional trainings. SitusAMC does not accept unsolicited resumes from staffing agencies, search firms or any third parties. Any unsolicited resume submitted to SitusAMC in any manner will be considered SitusAMC property, and SitusAMC will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume.

The annual full time base salary range for this role is

$70,000.00 - $90,000.00

Specific compensation is determined through interviews and a review of relevant education, experience, training, skills, geographic location and alignment with market data. Additionally, certain positions may be eligible to receive a discretionary bonus as determined by bonus program guidelines, position eligibility and SitusAMC Senior Management approval. Title: Business Intelligence and Compliance Analyst- REMOTE
Description:
Lensa is a career site that helps job seekers find great jobs in the US. We are not a staffing firm or agency. Lensa does not hire directly for these jobs, but promotes jobs on LinkedIn on behalf of its direct clients, recruitment ad agencies, and marketing partners. Lensa partners with DirectEmployers to promote this job for Ryder. Clicking "Apply Now" or "Read more" on Lensa redirects you to the job board/employer site. Any information collected there is subject to their terms and privacy notice.

Job Seekers can review the Job Applicant Privacy Policy by clicking here (http://ryder.com/job-applicant-privacy-policy) .

Summary

Job Description :

The Business Intelligence, Analytics & Reporting Analyst will gather, analyze, and understand business needs, as well as lead reporting/analytics improvement projects related to Workday data. The incumbent will communicate with users, examine business processes and requests, and develop detailed requirements for the creation of dashboards/data visualizations, reports, and report enhancements. In addition, the individual will formulate and recommend WD-based solutions and options that improve efficiency, effectiveness, and automation for HR and Finance. The individual will play a key role in creating and improving data visualizations within Workday via dashboards, discovery boards, etc. The individual will also be responsible for annual compliance reporting in partnership with HR's Compliance team.

***** REMOTE work from HOME*****

Essential Functions


Develops Workday dashboards and discovery boards to provide the business with insights with the data needed to make data-influenced decisions. Consults with other departments within Ryder on best reporting solutions in Workday.
Develops automated solutions for the HCM/FIN reporting team's manual processes.
Partners with HR's Compliance team to gather, clean, and format data needed for Ryder's annual submissions to state and federal governing bodies.
Facilitates requirements by organizing gathering sessions and other related events. Examines and evaluates business needs/requests to describe what processes and data elements are needed to fulfill the request.


Additional Responsibilities


Performs other duties as assigned.


Skills And Abilities


Analyze and solve problems., Required
Read and/or listen and understand information and ideas communicated., Required
Detailed oriented., Required
Present information and ideas clearly and understandably to others., Required
Effectively facilitate meetings, work sessions, and training., Required
Interact with employees at all levels of the organization., Required
Aptitude to learn a new business and systems., Required
Guide, engage, and impart knowledge to others., Required
Business planning and strategic thinking., Required


Qualifications


Bachelor's Degree in preferably business or in a quantitative discipline such as mathematics, statistics, economics, computer science, MIS or related field., Required
Master's Degree in in industrial/organization psychology., Preferred
1 year or more in in business reporting or consulting., Required
1 year or more in experience in data visualization., Preferred
Data visualization tools/configuration Intermediate, Required
Workday report and Prism dataset configuration Intermediate, Required
Ryder business knowledge / practices / processes Intermediate, Required


Travel


Yes, 1-10%


Job Category: General Human Resources

Compensation Information

The compensation offered to a candidate may be influenced by a variety of factors, including the candidate's relevant experience; education, including relevant degrees or certifications; work location; market data/ranges; internal equity; internal salary ranges; etc. The position may also be eligible to receive an annual bonus, commission, and/or long-term incentive plan based on the level and/or type. Pay Type

Salaried

Minimum Pay Range

$70,000

Maximum Pay Range

$80,000

Title: Database Administrator (Remote)
Description:
Lensa is a career site that helps job seekers find great jobs in the US. We are not a staffing firm or agency. Lensa does not hire directly for these jobs, but promotes jobs on LinkedIn on behalf of its direct clients, recruitment ad agencies, and marketing partners. Lensa partners with DirectEmployers to promote this job for GovCIO. Clicking "Apply Now" or "Read more" on Lensa redirects you to the job board/employer site. Any information collected there is subject to their terms and privacy notice.

Overview

GovCIO is currently hiring a talented and experienced Database Administrator to focus on designing, implementing, and optimizing SQL server and database solutions to support Veterans Affairs operational needs. This position leads database architecture, resolves advanced issues, and drives performance enhancements. This position will be fully remote located within the United States.

Responsibilities


Designs and implements database structures that fit with current and future needs of the organization.
Manages database security by setting up user roles and permissions.
Creates backup and recovery procedures to ensure data integrity and availability.
Monitors database performance and optimizes database structures for faster data access.
Troubleshoots and resolves database issues and errors.


Qualifications

Required Skills and Experience :


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, information technology, engineering or a related field with 12 years of relevant experience. (or commensurate experience)
Strong knowledge of relational database theory and SQL.
Experience in developing and maintaining low-code automation tools (such as SharePoint, PowerBI, Jira/Confluence, and others).
Expertise in designing and optimizing data structures for storage, retrieval, and analysis.
Ability to write efficient and optimized SQL queries to retrieve and manipulate data.
Demonstrated experience managing SQL/Oracle or other data management systems.‚ÄØ
Demonstrated experience configuring/integrating platform or application API‚Äôs
Proven ability to quickly learn, adapt, and effectively apply new tools and technologies.
Strong problem-solving skills, with a self-motivated and customer-focused approach.
Excellent communication skills, capable of working directly with stakeholders and team members.
Ability to handle projects independently, from requirement gathering to solution delivery.
Facilitate API design decisions in consideration with:
On-premises or cloud-based infrastructure
Datasets requirements
Security protocols need to be implemented
Functionalities based on the architectural style(s) or pattern(s) to be employed


Preferred Skills And Experience


Familiarity with Agile methodologies and project management tools.
Certifications in relevant technologies (e.g., Microsoft Certified: Data Analyst Associate).


Clearance Required


Ability to obtain and maintain a suitability/Public Trust


#TAPS

Company Overview

GovCIO is a team of transformers--people who are passionate about transforming government IT. Every day, we make a positive impact by delivering innovative IT services and solutions that improve how government agencies operate and serve our citizens.

But we can't do it alone. We need great people to help us do great things - for our customers, our culture, and our ability to attract other great people. We are changing the face of government IT and building a workforce that fuels this mission. Are you ready to be a transformer?

What You Can Expect

Interview & Hiring Process

If you are selected to move forward through the process, here‚Äôs what you canexpect:


During the Interview Process
Virtual video interview conducted via video with the hiring manager and/or team
Camera must be on
A valid photo ID must be presented during each interview
During the Hiring Process
Enhanced Biometrics ID verification screening
Background check, to include:
Criminal history (past 7 years)
Verification of your highest level of education
Verification of your employment history (past 7 years), based on information provided in your application


Employee Perks

Benefits

At GovCIO, we consistently hear that meaningful work and a collaborative team environment are two of the top reasons our employees enjoy working here. In addition, our employees have access to a range of perks and benefits to support their personal and professional well-being, beyond the standard company offered health benefits, including:


Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
Corporate Discounts
Learning & Development platform, to include certification preparation content
Training, Education and Certification Assistance*
Referral Bonus Program
Internal Mobility Program
Pet Insurance
Flexible Work Environment
Available to full-time employees


Our employees‚Äô unique talents and contributions are the driving force behind our success in supporting our customers, which ultimately fuels the success of our company. Join us and be a part of a culture that invests in its people and prioritizes continuous enhancement of the employee experience.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. EOE, including disability/vets.

Posted Pay Range

The posted pay range, if referenced, reflects the range expected for this position at the commencement of employment, however, base pay offered may vary depending on multiple individualized factors, including market location, job-related knowledge, skills, education, experience, and internal equity. The total compensation package for this position may also include other compensation elements, to be discussed during the hiring process. If hired, employee will be in an ‚Äúat-will position‚Äù and the GovCIO reserves the right to modify base salary (as well as any other discretionary payment or compensation program) at any time, including for reasons related to individual performance, GovCIO or individual department/team performance, and market factors.

Posted Salary Range

USD $130,000.00 - USD $150,000.00 /Yr.

Title: PHADV I Data Entry
Description:
Lensa is a career site that helps job seekers find great jobs in the US. We are not a staffing firm or agency. Lensa does not hire directly for these jobs, but promotes jobs on LinkedIn on behalf of its direct clients, recruitment ad agencies, and marketing partners. Lensa partners with DirectEmployers to promote this job for City of New York. Clicking "Apply Now" or "Read more" on Lensa redirects you to the job board/employer site. Any information collected there is subject to their terms and privacy notice.

Job Description

ONLY PERMANENT EMPLOYEES IN THE TITLE AND THOSE THAT ARE REACHABLE ON THE PUBLIC HEALTH ADVISER (SCHOOL HEALTH) CIVIL SERVICE LIST ARE ELIGIBLE TO APPLY.

Division/Program Summary

The Division of Family and Child Health, Office of School Health (OSH) Vision Program provides mandated vision screening services to Pre-K, kindergarten and first grade students throughout the five boroughs of New York City. The Vision Program is partnered with Warby Parker, a manufacturer and retailer of prescription eyeglasses. Warby Parker provides free eyeglass to students who fails the vision screenings.

Position Summary

The Public Health Adviser plays an integral role in providing preventative health services for students in NYC schools. Reporting to the Data Entry Supervisor, the Public Health Adviser will assist with ensuring all prescriptions are updated in the system.

Job Duties And Responsibilities


Receive and review incoming mail for prescriptions listed on Eye Report and Recommendation forms (E12s) provided by a student‚Äôs optometrist.
Verify OSIS # by checking the name and date of birth to ensure it corresponds with the correct student.
Enter Ophthalmologist and Optometrist exam results for Eye report and recommendations (E12s) into the Automated Students Health Records (ASHR) database.
Contact schools, doctor‚Äôs offices, and parent for missing information.
Review and enter completed E12‚Äôs prior to returning to school nurse.
Enter data accurately and in a timely manner into Automated Student Health Record (ASHR) ‚Äì prepare paperwork for filing.
Key-in non-priority forms from assigned borough in correct order, after priority forms are completed.
Other clerical duties, filing, photocopying, faxing etc.
City Wide travel and flexibility with location of assignment may be required based on programmatic needs.


Why You Should Work For Us


Benefits: City employees are entitled to unmatched benefits such as:
a premium-free health insurance plan that saves employees over $10K annually, per a 2024 assessment.
additional health, fitness, and financial benefits may be available based on the position‚Äôs associated union/benefit fund.
a public sector defined benefit pension plan with steady monthly payments in retirement.
a tax-deferred savings program and
a robust Worksite Wellness Program that offers resources and opportunities to keep you healthy while serving New Yorkers.
Work From Home Policy: Depending on your position, you may be able to work up to two days during the week from home.
Job Security - you could enjoy more job security compared to private sector employment and be able to contribute to making NYC a healthy place to live and work.


Established in 1805, the New York City Department of Health and Mental Hygiene (NYC Health Department) is the oldest and largest health department in the U.S., dedicated to protecting and improving the health of NYC. Our mission is to safeguard the health of every resident and cultivate a city where everyone, regardless of age, background, or location, can achieve their optimal health. We provide a wide array of programs and services focused on food and nutrition, anti-tobacco support, chronic disease prevention, HIV/AIDS treatment, family and child health, environmental health, mental health, and social justice initiatives. As the primary population health strategist and policy authority for NYC, with a rich history of public health initiatives and scientific advancements, from addressing the 1822 yellow fever outbreak to the COVID-19 pandemic, we serve as a global leader in public health innovation and expertise.

Come join us and help to continue our efforts in making a difference in the lives of all New Yorkers!

Commitment To Equity

The City of New York is an inclusive equal opportunity employer committed to recruiting and retaining a diverse workforce and providing a work environment that is free from discrimination and harassment based upon any legally protected status or protected characteristic, including but not limited to an individual's sex, race, color, ethnicity, national origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, gender identity, or pregnancy.

The NYC Health Department is an inclusive equal opportunity employer committed to providing access and reasonable accommodation to all individuals. Qualifications


A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university, including or supplemented by twelve semester credits in health education or in health, social or biological sciences; or
A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university, and six months of full-time satisfactory experience in a health promotion or disease intervention/prevention program, performing one or more of the following: interviewing, conducting field investigations, assessing health risks,


making referrals, or collecting and analyzing epidemiological data; or


A four-year high school diploma or its educational equivalent approved by a State's Department of Education or a recognized accrediting organization and four years of full-time satisfactory experience as described in ‚Äú2‚Äù above; or
Education and/or experience equivalent to ‚Äú1,‚Äù ‚Äú2‚Äù or ‚Äú3‚Äù above. Undergraduate college credit can be substituted for experience on the basis of 30 semester credits from an accredited college for one year of full-time experience. However, all candidates must have a four-year high school diploma or its educational equivalent, and either twelve semester credits as described in ‚Äú1‚Äù above or six months of experience as described in ‚Äú2‚Äù above.

at least one additional year of experience as described in Qualification Requirement 2 above.

Job Description

ONLY PERMANENT EMPLOYEES IN THE TITLE AND THOSE THAT ARE REACHABLE ON THE PUBLIC HEALTH ADVISER (SCHOOL HEALTH) CIVIL SERVICE LIST ARE ELIGIBLE TO APPLY.

Division/Program Summary

The Division of Family and Child Health, Office of School Health (OSH) Vision Program provides mandated vision screening services to Pre-K, kindergarten and first grade students throughout the five boroughs of New York City. The Vision Program is partnered with Warby Parker, a manufacturer and retailer of prescription eyeglasses. Warby Parker provides free eyeglass to students who fails the vision screenings.

Position Summary

The Public Health Adviser plays an integral role in providing preventative health services for students in NYC schools. Reporting to the Data Entry Supervisor, the Public Health Adviser will assist with ensuring all prescriptions are updated in the system.

Job Duties And Responsibilities

  • Receive and review incoming mail for prescriptions listed on Eye Report and Recommendation forms (E12s) provided by a student‚Äôs optometrist.
  • Verify OSIS # by checking the name and date of birth to ensure it corresponds with the correct student.
  • Enter Ophthalmologist and Optometrist exam results for Eye report and recommendations (E12s) into the Automated Students Health Records (ASHR) database.
  • Contact schools, doctor‚Äôs offices, and parent for missing information.
  • Review and enter completed E12‚Äôs prior to returning to school nurse.
  • Enter data accurately and in a timely manner into Automated Student Health Record (ASHR) ‚Äì prepare paperwork for filing.
  • Key-in non-priority forms from assigned borough in correct order, after priority forms are completed.
  • Other clerical duties, filing, photocopying, faxing etc.
  • City Wide travel and flexibility with location of assignment may be required based on programmatic needs.

Why You Should Work For Us

  • Benefits: City employees are entitled to unmatched benefits such as:
  • a premium-free health insurance plan that saves employees over $10K annually, per a 2024 assessment.
  • additional health, fitness, and financial benefits may be available based on the position‚Äôs associated union/benefit fund.
  • a public sector defined benefit pension plan with steady monthly payments in retirement.
  • a tax-deferred savings program and
  • a robust Worksite Wellness Program that offers resources and opportunities to keep you healthy while serving New Yorkers.
  • Work From Home Policy: Depending on your position, you may be able to work up to two days during the week from home.
  • Job Security - you could enjoy more job security compared to private sector employment and be able to contribute to making NYC a healthy place to live and work.

As the primary population health strategist and policy authority for NYC, with a rich history of public health initiatives and scientific advancements, from addressing the 1822 yellow fever outbreak to the COVID-19 pandemic, we serve as a global leader in public health innovation and expertise.

Come join us and help to continue our efforts in making a difference in the lives of all New Yorkers!

Title: Data Insights Analyst II, Entry Level
Description:
Verified Job On Employer Career Site




Job Summary:

Care.com is a consumer tech company dedicated to helping families find care solutions. They are seeking a Data Insights Analyst II to leverage data and analytics to generate actionable insights that support critical business decisions within the Customer Experience and Operations teams.




Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Assist Customer Experience and Operations teams in tackling intricate business challenges. Formulate data-driven strategies and convey key findings through compelling narratives to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

‚Ä¢ Work with the Enterprise Network Operations team to analyze backup care fulfillment, as well as caregiver availability, quality and supply.

‚Ä¢ Partner with the Enterprise Servicing Operations team to improve internal reporting and processes including representative productivity and phone/email/chat performance.

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with Enterprise Voice of the Customer stakeholders to accurately calculate and communicate user surveys and comments.

‚Ä¢ Advise Enterprise Trust & Safety team on background checks and vetting.

‚Ä¢ Take ownership, from definition to reporting, of metrics related to the functional area that you support

‚Ä¢ Develop advanced metrics and visuals, by collecting and integrating data from various sources, including web analytics tools and internal databases

‚Ä¢ Be a Care data guru - be the point of contact for all data questions and insights




Qualifications:




Required:

‚Ä¢ 2+ years of professional experience in a business intelligence analyst and/or data analyst position

‚Ä¢ Expert SQL skills are required (Snowflake, Mysql)

‚Ä¢ Proven ability in data analysis, structuring, transforming, and visualization is required, with a strong preference for Tableau. Experience with Domo, PowerBI, or Looker will also be considered.

‚Ä¢ Experience measuring the impact of products and/or marketing initiatives on conversion and revenue

‚Ä¢ Experience Influencing product and marketing teams to make data-driven decisions

‚Ä¢ Take initiative in solving business questions that data could potentially answer by producing top-down data-driven solutions to address them

‚Ä¢ Strong product development mindset and focus on actionable analytics: e.g., Ability to surface signals in our data and work with Product/Engineering to transform these into concrete tests

‚Ä¢ Experience building comprehensive dashboards

‚Ä¢ Experience completing exploratory deep dives into data to find ways to optimize the customer experience

‚Ä¢ Experience using relational databases and big data via writing performant queries in SQL against large datasets in various environments

‚Ä¢ Experience crafting and presenting complex business case studies

‚Ä¢ Ability to work independently with high-level direction

‚Ä¢ Willingness to proactively engage with partners across many disciplines

‚Ä¢ Consistent ability to produce quality, accurate and highly detailed work product

‚Ä¢ Be a creative, global thinker & team player




Preferred:

‚Ä¢ Experience with Amplitude, a plus

‚Ä¢ Statistical knowledge and modeling, a plus




Company:

Care.com is where families go to find care and where caregivers go to find meaningful work. Founded in 2006, the company is headquartered in Austin, Texas, USA, with a team of 1001-5000 employees. The company is currently Public Company. Care.com has a track record of offering H1B sponsorships.

Title: Business Analyst IT (SQL)
Description:
Lensa is a career site that helps job seekers find great jobs in the US. We are not a staffing firm or agency. Hybrid - 3 days onsite

Description


Requires Problem Solving Skills, experience in developing SQL, and excellent communication skills. Ability to communicate effectively with all levels of leadership, with business partners, and with IT partners.
Responsible for the lifecycle of reporting from gathering requirements to developing the SQL and into support.
IT business consulting activities for the business, serving as the primary interface between business groups and IT.
Responsible for understanding the work processes of the assigned business group to meet business needs.
Provides technical knowledge to ensure efficient design, development, implementation, and support of systems with programmers to explain solutions.
Responsible for overall customer satisfaction, customer communications, analysis, problem resolution consultation, testing and development of solutions, and adherence to service level agreements.
Workers at this level participate in project implementations to understand impacts to their assigned business groups.
Responsible for working with assigned business areas to do regular prioritization and planning.


Required Qualifications


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related discipline. Or in lieu of a degree, 4 years of related business experience.
1-3 years of related experience in business and or information technology systems analysis or support.
Minimum of 3 years experience in SQL development, support and troubleshooting.
Demonstrated strong analytical and communication skills. Ability to work effectively with customers, IT management and teammates.
Demonstrated ability to gather requirements.

US Tech Solutions is a global staff augmentation firm providing a wide range of talent on-demand and total workforce solutions. To know more about US Tech Solutions, please visit www.ustechsolutions.com (http://www.ustechsolutionsinc.com) .

If you have questions about this posting, please contact support@lensa.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Founded in 2009, Zest AI has been pioneering innovative AI technology with a mission to expand credit access to create opportunities for more Americans to pursue their financial goals. Zest AI is transforming the $17 trillion US consumer credit market by delivering AI technology that helps lenders identify creditworthy borrowers overlooked by traditional methods, while leveling the playing field so financial institutions of all sizes can harness AI to provide better lending experiences.




With over 50 issued and pending patents across automation, accuracy, performance, and model explainability, Zest AI is a leader in financial technology, providing financial institutions with AI tools that create a more resilient US financial system and a stronger U.S. economy. With over 600 active AI models, financial institutions rely on Zest AI's comprehensive suite of solutions spanning marketing, underwriting, fraud detection, lending intelligence, and more to make smarter lending decisions while improving profitability. This US-based technology as a service company is headquartered in Los Angeles, California.




About the Role

We are looking for Data Analysts, whether recent graduates or those early in their careers, to join our team. In this role, you will interpret and analyze complex data sets, develop actionable insights to drive business strategies, and effectively communicate findings to both technical and non-technical audiences. You will also manage projects, ensuring data-driven initiatives are completed on time and within scope.




As a Data Analyst, you will collaborate closely with Data Scientists, Software Engineers, and the Client Success team to deliver data solutions that exceed client expectations. Additionally, you‚Äôll have the chance to lead various projects under the mentorship of senior team members, offering valuable opportunities for growth and development.




Responsibilities

Analyze and interpret complex data sets and machine learning model results using advanced statistical techniques to identify relevant trends and patterns.
Translate model behavior and analytical findings into actionable business insight.
Develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality.
Collaborate with senior members to prioritize work, promoting and supporting data-driven decision-making within the team.
Communicate findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders through standard and ad hoc. reports.




Qualifications

Expertise in data wrangling and manipulation in Python and SQL.
Solid understanding of machine learning and statistical analysis.
Good business acumen, with the ability to formulate approaches and solve complex business problems.
Strong coding skills, comfortable with Object-Oriented Programming.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to actively listen, incorporate feedback, and present complex ideas clearly and concisely.
Good project management skills, committed to maintaining quality and meeting deadlines, and willing to raise concerns if obstacles arise.
Experience utilizing foundational models such as ChatGPT, Claude, and Llama to assist with day-to-day tasks are a strongly preferred
A [STEM] degree in fundamental mathematics is highly preferred ‚Äì ie: Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering, etc.




Perks and benefits:

The opportunity to join a mission-focused company
People ‚Äì the best part of Zest
Robust medical, dental and vision insurance plans
Annual bonus plan participation
401(k) with generous match
Employee Awards and Recognition
11 company holidays
Winter break (office closed between Christmas and New Year's Day)
Unlimited vacation time
Employee Resource Groups
Generous family leave policy (12 week maternity leave / 6 week paternity leave)
Phone, internet, wellness, and professional development allowances
Employee gatherings, including Town Hall meetings




Additionally, Zestys based locally and around our Burbank HQ enjoy:

Beautiful, modern, dog-friendly office with lounge areas, video games, and gigantic jigsaw puzzles
Daily catered lunches from LA‚Äôs best restaurants and a fully stocked kitchen
Complimentary manicures, pedicures, and mindfulness sessions
Company happy hours, social events, outings, and much more!




About Zest AI:

Creating a diverse and inclusive culture where all are welcomed, valued, and empowered to achieve our full potential is important to who we are and where we‚Äôre headed in the future. We know that unique backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives help us think bigger, spark innovation, and succeed together. Zest is committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion and encourages professionals from underrepresented groups in technology and financial services to apply.




Our core values are Communication, Collaboration, Bias for Action, Client-centricity, and Heart. Learn more at Zest.ai, follow us on LinkedIn (linkedin.com/company/zest-ai/) or Twitter @Zest_AI, or check out our Insights blog (https://www.zest.ai/cms/insights

Title: Data Analyst II, Site Analytics & Optimization
Description:
About The Role

We are seeking a highly motivated and analytical Data Analyst for Site Merchandising to join the Uber Grocery and Retail team. In this key role, you will participate in and drive the execution of our site merchandising insights and analytics in order to create a world-class shopping experience for consumers. You will be accountable for building and maintaining success of the insights & analytics reporting and tools; including content and offers strategy, seasonal campaigns and category management efforts, while collaborating with product, regional, and cross-functional teams to elevate merchandising standards across all markets. You'll leverage insights to ensure an engaging yet seamless shopping experience, and deliver operational excellence in all merchandising efforts.

What You'll Do


Own the global vision and strategy for the global grocery and retail categories - e.g. define reporting and tools required to measure platform performance, themes, promotional/offers ideas, aisle structure/ranking, assortment opportunities, category specific product requirements - including what is standardised and localised.
Provide guidance on category content and product requirements: work closely with cross functional teams to build and launch product, assets and creative; work with local teams to ensure high quality storefronts and a high standard of execution for campaigns aligned with global vision and objectives
Tell the consumer story: Use performance data, consumer feedback, consider seasonality and Industry trends to tell the consumer experience story. As the consumer story owner you will use this story to enhance the consumer journey, drive new strategies, and influence stakeholders.
Merchandising calendar and Promotional plans: Develop and manage a global site merchandising calendar, planning key retail moments and other promotional offers to maximize reach, relevance and impact; ensure that campaigns align with product strategies, regional, cultural, and seasonal trends.
Data-Driven Optimization: Generate and share insights, learnings and best practices with local merchandisers utilizing data, insights, and industry analysis to continually refine merchandising strategies and campaign designs, optimizing engagement, conversion rates, and ROI. Measure platform health and report on performance regularly against key metrics with clear insights and recommendations.
Operational Excellence: Develop and maintain effective workflows, processes, and timelines for merchandising activities, ensuring efficient and flawless execution of all merchandising initiatives.


Basic Qualifications


Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, or related field
2+ years of experience in merchandising, e-commerce insights & analytics, or related roles, with a focus on global campaigns and category management.
Strong analytical skills with experience using data to drive decision-making and optimize merchandising strategies, reporting building, SQL query builder.


Preferred Qualifications


Excellent communication, and collaboration skills, with experience working cross-functionally in a fast-paced environment.
Exceptional project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple initiatives simultaneously and meet tight deadlines.
Ability to innovate and experiment with a focus on consumer experience, engagement, and conversion.


For Chicago, IL-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$122,000 per year - USD$135,500 per year. For Dallas, TX-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$122,000 per year - USD$135,500 per year. For New York, NY-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$135,000 per year - USD$150,000 per year. For San Francisco, CA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$135,000 per year - USD$150,000 per year. For Seattle, WA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$122,000 per year - USD$135,500 per year. For Washington, DC-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$135,000 per year - USD$150,000 per year. For all US locations, you will be eligible to participate in Uber's bonus program, and may be offered an equity award & other types of comp. You will also be eligible for various benefits. More details can be found at the following link https://www.uber.com/careers/benefits., For Chicago, IL-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$122,000 per year - USD$135,500 per year. For Dallas, TX-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$122,000 per year - USD$135,500 per year. For New York, NY-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$135,000 per year - USD$150,000 per year. More details can be found at the following link https://www.uber.com/careers/benefits.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Disney Streaming Analytics‚Äô Content & Engagement Core Data team is seeking a Data Analyst who will help build and scale our data that will empower us to measure and understand sports content performance between ESPN, Disney+, Hulu, and more! We partner with other teams across the business to turn data into information, information into insights and insights into key business decisions that steer the strategic direction of the company. The right person for this role thrives in a fast-paced environment, loves problem-solving, and is a good communicator and a self-starter.

We are seeking a technical Data Analyst who will focus on developing sports data solutions for our many stakeholders. Collaborating with data engineering, data science, and both ESPN & Disney business teams, this role will be a subject matter expert in understanding Sports content across a variety of streaming services, product offerings, and platforms, while supporting multiple product launches and initiatives. This expertise will manifest in the design and implementation of core sports content data models that enable internal clients to explore, analyze, and monitor data. This role in particular will have an additional focus on the TVE (TV Everywhere) offerings of our streaming services and help to better understand the engagement of TVE users in comparison to our DTC subscribers.

Responsibilities:



ETL & Metric Design: Own metric design and creation by defining business requirements, framework & optimization, and long term data scalability.
Creation of a Single Source of Truth: Bring together analysts and stakeholders from across the team to define and standardize metrics.
Partnership and communication: Partner closely with business stakeholders to identify and understand what they need to drive decisions, and with other data teams to improve platform capabilities around data modeling, testing platforms, data visualization, and data architecture.
Reporting and Performance: support reporting for exceptionally large-scale data. Serve as an expert for analysts on the team and a partner with Data Engineering in designing and building performant ETLs, intermediary tables, and beautiful and quick Tableau and Looker dashboards.



Minimum Qualifications:



A Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, MIS, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Engineering, or related degree.
3+ years of analytical experience, ideally specifically in analytics and/or engineering.
Mastery of SQL, some experience with Airflow, Databricks, etc. a plus
Experience developing and maintaining optimized tables for reporting through ETLs.
Project and resource management experience, outlining objectives, and timelines, and coordinating work across multiple contributors.
Some experience with Python/R or other statistical programming languages.
Fearless in the face of large-scale data challenges and ready to get hands dirty
Strong communication skills, as well as written and verbal presentation skills and experience presenting to diverse audiences.
Expertise developing data exploration and data visualization tools like Looker, Tableau, Chartio, etc.



Nice to haves:



A love of sports
Familiarity with the TVE (TV Everywhere) streaming service model and related concepts



#DISNEYANALYTICS

#DISNEYTECH

The hiring range for this position in New York is $99,900 - $133,900 per year and in Los Angeles is $95,300 - $127,800 per year. The base pay actually offered will take into account internal equity and also may vary depending on the candidate‚Äôs geographic region, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience among other factors. A bonus and/or long-term incentive units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to the full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the level and position offered.

Title: Data Analyst II, Site Analytics & Optimization
Description:
About The Role

We are seeking a highly motivated and analytical Data Analyst for Site Merchandising to join the Uber Grocery and Retail team. In this key role, you will participate in and drive the execution of our site merchandising insights and analytics in order to create a world-class shopping experience for consumers. You will be accountable for building and maintaining success of the insights & analytics reporting and tools; including content and offers strategy, seasonal campaigns and category management efforts, while collaborating with product, regional, and cross-functional teams to elevate merchandising standards across all markets. You'll leverage insights to ensure an engaging yet seamless shopping experience, and deliver operational excellence in all merchandising efforts.

What You'll Do


Own the global vision and strategy for the global grocery and retail categories - e.g. define reporting and tools required to measure platform performance, themes, promotional/offers ideas, aisle structure/ranking, assortment opportunities, category specific product requirements - including what is standardised and localised.
Provide guidance on category content and product requirements: work closely with cross functional teams to build and launch product, assets and creative; work with local teams to ensure high quality storefronts and a high standard of execution for campaigns aligned with global vision and objectives
Tell the consumer story: Use performance data, consumer feedback, consider seasonality and Industry trends to tell the consumer experience story. As the consumer story owner you will use this story to enhance the consumer journey, drive new strategies, and influence stakeholders.
Merchandising calendar and Promotional plans: Develop and manage a global site merchandising calendar, planning key retail moments and other promotional offers to maximize reach, relevance and impact; ensure that campaigns align with product strategies, regional, cultural, and seasonal trends.
Data-Driven Optimization: Generate and share insights, learnings and best practices with local merchandisers utilizing data, insights, and industry analysis to continually refine merchandising strategies and campaign designs, optimizing engagement, conversion rates, and ROI. Measure platform health and report on performance regularly against key metrics with clear insights and recommendations.
Operational Excellence: Develop and maintain effective workflows, processes, and timelines for merchandising activities, ensuring efficient and flawless execution of all merchandising initiatives.


Basic Qualifications


Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, or related field
2+ years of experience in merchandising, e-commerce insights & analytics, or related roles, with a focus on global campaigns and category management.
Strong analytical skills with experience using data to drive decision-making and optimize merchandising strategies, reporting building, SQL query builder.


Preferred Qualifications


Excellent communication, and collaboration skills, with experience working cross-functionally in a fast-paced environment.
Exceptional project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple initiatives simultaneously and meet tight deadlines.
Ability to innovate and experiment with a focus on consumer experience, engagement, and conversion.


For Chicago, IL-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$122,000 per year - USD$135,500 per year. For Dallas, TX-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$122,000 per year - USD$135,500 per year. For New York, NY-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$135,000 per year - USD$150,000 per year. For San Francisco, CA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$135,000 per year - USD$150,000 per year. For Seattle, WA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$122,000 per year - USD$135,500 per year. For Washington, DC-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$135,000 per year - USD$150,000 per year. For all US locations, you will be eligible to participate in Uber's bonus program, and may be offered an equity award & other types of comp. You will also be eligible for various benefits. More details can be found at the following link https://www.uber.com/careers/benefits.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
NOTE:- Strictly on (w2) for OPT candidates only.




Required Skills:

Ideal candidate should have a degree in a quantitative field (e.g., mathematics, computer science, physics, economics, engineering, statistics, operations research, quantitative social science, etc.).
Basic Knowledge on software development principles and architecture.
Good analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Ability to break down and understand complex business problems, define a solution and implement it using advanced quantitative methods.
Familiarity with programming for data analysis; ideally Python, SQL, or R.
Solid oral and written communication skills, especially around analytical concepts and methods.
Great work ethic and intellectual curiosity.
Knowledge of Cloud technologies such as AWS or Google Cloud.
Knowledge of any relational database such as My SQL.
Must be a team player with excellent communication and problem-solving skills and have experience working with customers across teams.

Title: Data Analyst- low salary
Description:
One of our staffing partners is hiring for its ecommerce client a data analyst with tableau and some data engineering skills to support business operations through analytics, reporting.




Experience of 2-3 years minimum. Actual work experience with USA based clients not Internship or School project or overseas experience. Not looking for senior programmers due to low pay

Salary offered $60-65k per year




Direct applicants only no c2c or company candidates due to low margins. The staffing company or client will reach directly to the qualified applicants.




Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and maintain BI dashboards using Tableau
Perform advanced data modeling, cleansing, and transformation for accurate reporting
Build and optimize ETL pipelines to ensure seamless data flow across systems
Work with structured and unstructured datasets for comprehensive analysis
Write complex SQL queries for data extraction and performance tuning
Collaborate with data engineers to enhance data infrastructure and improve accessibility
Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and provide actionable insights
Automate reporting processes using Python, R, or other scripting tools

Requirements:

Strong experience with BI tools (Power BI or Tableau)
Proficiency in SQL for data querying and manipulation
Hands-on experience with ETL processes and data pipeline development
Familiarity with cloud-based data warehouses (Snowflake, BigQuery, or Redshift)
Ability to optimize database performance for efficient querying
Understanding of Python or R for data analytics and automation
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills
Experience with Spark, Hadoop, or other big data technologies

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for a detail-oriented Data Analyst who will be working across the business to shape data models, cleanse and transform datasets, and support strategic decision-making through intuitive dashboards and visualizations.




What You'll Be Doing:

Building and maintaining data models to support reporting and analytics.
Cleaning, transforming, and validating raw data from multiple sources.
Creating dashboards and reports using BI tools.
Collaborating with stakeholders to understand data needs and priorities.
Supporting internal teams with ad hoc data requests and insights.
Laying the groundwork to eventually support more advanced statistical or machine learning projects.




What We're Looking For:

1‚Äì3 years of experience in a data analysis or similar role.
Experience using BI tools ‚Äì Sisense is ideal, but Power BI, Tableau, Sigma, or ThoughtSpot are also helpful.
Solid SQL skills and confidence working with relational databases.
A logical approach to data transformation and wrangling.
Comfortable discussing data requirements and presenting findings to non-technical stakeholders.
Ambition to progress within the data function.




Nice-to-Haves:

Experience with Python or R (even just the basics).
Understanding of statistics or a background in maths, engineering, or computer science.
Exposure to cloud data platforms (e.g. Snowflake, BigQuery, Redshift).

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
POSITION SUMMARY:




Jackson Healthcare is seeking an experienced Data Analyst to join our growing information technology team! In this position you‚Äôll perform extensive quantitative and qualitative analysis to support business decision-making across the organization. The creation and use of reports and dashboards delivered through the Microsoft Power BI platform and ancillary tools will be central to providing insights to business partners. The ability to work collaboratively and communicate effectively is critical to the success of this role.




THIS ROLE IS HYBRID AND REQUIRES RESIDING IN THE ATLANTA AREA. No relocation assistance will be provided with any offer.




ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES:




Collaborate frequently with business partners to understand their business processes and identify opportunities to drive better decision-making through data & analytic solutions
Gain familiarity with the data underlying Workday, Salesforce, ServiceNow, M365 and other platforms in use across the organization to draw out actionable insights
Perform quantitative and qualitative analysis around various business subject matters, and provide data driven and actionable insights through the creation of reports and data visualizations to facilitate business decision making
Design, develop, test, and support both standard and ad hoc reports and dashboards as requested by business partners
Ensure reports, dashboards and data feeds are secured and follow data governance and security policies
Analyze and interpret results using standard statistical tools and techniques
Develop templates and branding to deliver a consistent and intuitive end-user experience for analytic solutions




QUALIFICATIONS ‚Äì EDUCATION, WORK EXPERIENCE, CERTIFICATIONS:




3-5 years of experience in an analytical role
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business Administration, Information Systems, Information Technology, or related field or equivalent work experience required
Self-motivated with the ability to define, structure, and prioritize work




KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:




Expertise in building and deploying reports and dashboards in Microsoft Power BI
Familiarity with dimensional database models
Proficient with data visualizations and data storytelling to drive insights and decision-making
Expertise in Microsoft Excel
Excellent communication skills
Experience in mapping business processes and recommending changes to better align with analytical needs
Experience with one or more of the following business platforms preferred: Workday, Salesforce, ServiceNow
Experience in analytics for Human Resources, Insurance, or Medical Billing a plus

  • Merchandising calendar and Promotional plans: Develop and manage a global site merchandising calendar, planning key retail moments and other promotional offers to maximize reach, relevance and impact; ensure that campaigns align with product strategies, regional, cultural, and seasonal trends.
  • Data-Driven Optimization: Generate and share insights, learnings and best practices with local merchandisers utilizing data, insights, and industry analysis to continually refine merchandising strategies and campaign designs, optimizing engagement, conversion rates, and ROI. Measure platform health and report on performance regularly against key metrics with clear insights and recommendations.
  • Operational Excellence: Develop and maintain effective workflows, processes, and timelines for merchandising activities, ensuring efficient and flawless execution of all merchandising initiatives.

Basic Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, or related field
  • 2+ years of experience in merchandising, e-commerce insights & analytics, or related roles, with a focus on global campaigns and category management.
  • Strong analytical skills with experience using data to drive decision-making and optimize merchandising strategies, reporting building, SQL query builder.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Excellent communication, and collaboration skills, with experience working cross-functionally in a fast-paced environment.
  • Exceptional project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple initiatives simultaneously and meet tight deadlines.
  • Ability to innovate and experiment with a focus on consumer experience, engagement, and conversion.

For Chicago, IL-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$122,000 per year - USD$135,500 per year. For Dallas, TX-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$122,000 per year - USD$135,500 per year. For New York, NY-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$135,000 per year - USD$150,000 per year. For San Francisco, CA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$135,000 per year - USD$150,000 per year. For Seattle, WA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$122,000 per year - USD$135,500 per year. For Washington, DC-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$135,000 per year - USD$150,000 per year. For all US locations, you will be eligible to participate in Uber's bonus program, and may be offered an equity award & other types of comp. You will also be eligible for various benefits. More details can be found at the following link https://www.uber.com/careers/benefits.

Title: Data Analyst I
Description:
What You'll Do:

A Data Analyst on the Retailer Analytics team is a key player in understanding every aspect of Criteo‚Äôs complex Retail Media business. This role interfaces across the organization to answer challenging analytical questions related to the performance and growth of Criteo‚Äôs Retail Media solutions. The person occupying this position will have an exceptionally broad view of every aspect of Criteo‚Äôs business with a focus on Americas Retailers (Supply side). The scope involves both technically rigorous work, including the use leading-edge data analysis technologies, and daily interaction with other cross-functional business units across Commercial, Technical and Product teams, as well as our retailers.

Criteo‚Äôs high-growth business model brings both opportunities and challenges. This position involves dealing with a considerable amount of complex, real-world data and requires a candidate who is comfortable thinking of new and innovative ways to analyze data, solve problems, and think strategically. The ideal candidate can function with minimal oversight and has a strong ability to learn new concepts quickly.


Collaborate with Partner Success and Technical Solutions teams to drive retailer growth and increase performance through data-driven insights
Conduct ad hoc analyses for top Americas Retailers to identify revenue driving opportunities like inventory expansion, yield optimization, integration and tech improvements, rate card management, second-price auctions, ad rendering studies, etc.
Proactively identify and collect analytical, tooling and reporting needs from Commercial stakeholders (Partner Success Management and Technical Solutions teams); develop self-service tools to answer these needs using Tableau, Python or any other relevant technologies
Provide retailer or industry insights and present as appropriate to internal teams throughout the organization and to retailers when relevant
Develop intimate understanding of retailers‚Äô goals and needs, and partner with them and our internal commercial teams to formulate strategies for achieving joint objectives
Maintain deep knowledge of Criteo Retail Media products, technologies, and position in the marketplace



Who You Are:


Native-level English fluency
Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Economics, Engineering, Computer Science etc.)
Minimum 2 years full-time, analytics-relevant work experience ‚Äì experience in the digital industry is preferred
SQL proficiency is required
Background in any of the following is a plus: Tableau, Vertica, Hive/Hadoop, Python
Keen intellectual curiosity and ability to structure & solve difficult problems with minimal supervision
Passion for translating ‚Äòdata-speak‚Äô into relevant, compelling stories
Exceptional attention to detail coupled with an ability to see the big picture
Thorough conceptual and practical understanding of relational databases, data architecture/governance, and real-world application of statistical concepts
Effective presentation and public speaking skills with the ability to present and defend complex analysis both internally and externally to both technical and non-technical audiences.
A passion for story telling with data!
Must have the combination of technical skills, passion for learning, and the soft skills to work with all personality types in a dynamic environment



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is a leader in commerce media, helping brands, agencies, and publishers create meaningful consumer connections through AI-powered advertising solutions. We‚Äôre shaping a more open and sustainable digital future for advertising.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices across the globe or from the comfort of home, our 3,600 Criteos collaborate together to build an open, impactful, and forward-thinking environment.

We foster a workplace where everyone is valued, and employment decisions are based solely on skills, qualifications, and business needs‚Äînever on non-job-related factors or legally protected characteristics.

What We Offer:

üè† Own your work style ‚Äì Build your work around your life and not the other way around.

üìà Grow with us ‚Äì Learning, mentorship & career development programs.

üí™ Your wellbeing matters ‚Äì Health benefits, wellness perks & mental health support.

ü§ù A team that cares ‚Äì Diverse, inclusive, and globally connected.

üí∏ Fair pay & perks ‚Äì Competitive salary, equity, performance-based rewards and family-friendly policies.

Additional benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo.

For employees based in the US, certain roles at Criteo are eligible for additional rewards, including quarterly or annual bonus and restricted stock units. US-based employees receive access to healthcare, dental, and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with company match, short-term and long-term disability coverage, life insurance, family forming and wellness benefits, Flexible Work financial support, learning opportunities, and a robust annual leave plan including volunteer time off and summer vacation days.

The US base salary pay range for this position per year is:

$75,000 - $80,000

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
What You'll Do:


Partner with commercial teams to create and deliver Client Business Reviews, including custom analyses, optimization recommendations, media plans and forecasts to improve performance and drive incremental revenue
Design, manage, analyze, and communicate results of controlled A/B tests
Create and share market trends and benchmarks to support in strategic planning
Collaborate with Product Analytics to execute on performance-improving initiatives
Influence the Product Roadmap by sharing client needs and feedback with our product and R&D teams
Leverage the partnership with our Global Client Operations Center to identify ways to improve efficiency in executing tasks through automation or delegation
Develop expertise on a key growth area of the business.
Take ownership over knowledge sharing within the team and building client facing collateral
Troubleshoot campaign delivery and performance issues in time-sensitive, high-impact scenarios
Stay informed on industry trends and advancements in AdTech, analytics, forecasting, and attribution
Effectively communicate with teams and managers on project timelines and challenges



Who You Are:


Minimum 1 year full-time, analytics-relevant work experience with Python; previous experience with MySQL preferred
Native-level English fluency and strong presentation and public speaking skills, with the ability to present and defend complex analyses to both technical and non-technical audiences
Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
Conceptual and practical understanding of statistics and real-world application of statistical concepts particularly in a testing context
Experience with internet advertising technology (tagging, cookies, trafficking) and digital marketing concepts is preferred



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

For employees based in the US, certain roles at Criteo are eligible for additional rewards, including quarterly or annual bonus and restricted stock units. US-based employees receive access to healthcare, dental, and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with company match, short-term and long-term disability coverage, life insurance, family forming and wellness benefits, Flexible Work financial support, learning opportunities, and a robust annual leave plan including volunteer time off and summer vacation days.

The US base salary pay range for this position per year is:

$79,700 - $98,000
